strIntroduction: Ena city is located in Gifu prefecture, about an hour away by train from Nagoya. The vast area of Ena includes several smaller towns, villages and endless picturesque farm fields. For centuries local people have been relying on the blessings of nature for food and everyday items. Among Ena city's local crafts and products are soba noodles, kanten (agar based) foods, pottery, chestnut sweets and many fresh fruits and vegetables. In this day trip to Ena's countryside you will visit several of the city's best local craft and market facilities. You will not need to worry about transportation because a private taxi car will take you to all the places of interest. You will have the chance to experience soba noodles making, pottery making with local clay and materials, and a visit to two roadside stations where you can buy healthy local food. A guide-interpreter will accompany you during the day so that you can enjoy the activities without the language barrier. In addition, you will be able to see a giant dam and Japan's largest wooden water mill! Below is the suggested itinerary of this tour: Around 11 am: Takenami Station or Ena Station (accessible by train in about an hour from Nagoya on JR Chuo Line). Meet your guide and ride the private car. Go to Rassei-Misato roadside station and experience making your own soba noodles from soba (buckwheat) flour. Local women will explain to you the secrets of hand-made soba. The activity takes about 1.5 hours and you can eat the delicious soba you cooked yourself! Next, visit the Yamaoka Pottery Center and learn about the art of making pottery items with local materials and clay. Try creating up to 2 pottery items yourself in a challenging 2-hour hands-on activity! The next stop on the tour will be "Obachan-ichi Yamaoka", a roadside station next to which you will be amazed to see Japan's largest wooden water mill. The market is built near the giant Origawa Dam and offers splendid views over the entire area. Here you can buy fresh local fruits, vegetables, traditional chestnut sweets, as well products made from the local healthy product "kanten" (agar, an algae-delivered jelly). The packaged kanten ramen noodes are highly recommended! Finally, you will end the tour back at the station where you were picked up. Note: The starting point will be either Takenami Station or Ena Station. You will be informed about the pick-up place once the tour is confirmed.
strTitle: Try craft activities and local food in Ena city near Nagoya

strIntroduction: Ena city in the south-east part of Gifu prefecture is an ideal destination for a day trip from Nagoya if you are interested in exploring the deep aspects of Japan's history. Thanks to the rich cultural and historical heritage of Ena city, you can easily travel in time and visit different eras within one day. This is an ideal opportunity to see Japan's development throughout the centuries on a local level. In addition, you can enjoy scenic nature, delicious local food and sweets, as well as a pleasant countryside hot spring! In this one day tour you will go to Ena city and ride the charming local Akechi railway line. The train itself is an attraction of its own and on the way you will pass gentle hill slopes, forests and spacious farm fields. You will visit Iwamura town, a designated area with important historical heritage sites that you can easily explore riding on a rental bicycle. The well-preserved historical streets and former merchant residences will tell you the story of the Edo period, while the climb to the ruins of Iwamura Castle, considered one of the best three mountain castles in Japan, will reveal more of Japan's earlier Kamakura and Warring States periods. Later on, you will ride the local train again to reach Akechi town and Nihon Taisho-mura, a town-size reproduction of the classical Taisho period (early 20th century). You can stroll around the nostalgic streets of the town dressed in a Taisho-style hakama. Finally, what better way to end the trip than a relaxing soak in a pleasant countryside hot spring in the middle of the farm fields? Below is the suggested itinerary of this tour: 9:55 am (weekdays) or 9:28 am (weekends): Ena Station (recommended trains from Nagoya Station: 8:35 am on JR Chuo Line on weekdays or 8:16 am on JR Chuo Line on weekends). Claim your one-day pass for Akechi Railways from the station counter. 10:21 am (weekdays) or 10:30 am (weekends): local train from Ena to Iwamura Station 11:00 am: Arrive at Iwamura Station and rent a bicycle from the specialized shop in front of the station. Explore freely Iwamura town and Iwamura Castle ruins. Visit the historical residences, a splendid sake brewery and various sweets shops along the main street. Have free lunch in one of the many local restaurants and don't forget to try the local specialties: chestnut sweets (kuri-kinton) and castella cakes. 13:12 pm: local train from Iwamura Station to Akechi Station 13:33 pm: Stroll the nostalgic streets of Nihon Taisho-mura, a town-size reproduction of the Taisho period with its preserved old buildings and classical architectural style. A local guide will tell you more about the history of Taisho period and show you around the best sightseeing spots while you enjoy your time dressed in a Taisho-style hakama! 15:17 pm: local train from Akechi Station to Hanashiro Onsen Station. Make a stop to enjoy the relaxing hot spring water of this countryside onsen located in the middle of the farm fields, just next to the small unmanned station. 16:38 pm: local train from Hanashiro Onsen Station to Ena. End of tour around 17:15 at Ena Station. Enjoy the time slip back to Japan's historical periods during a pleasant day trip from Nagoya! Note: This is a self-guided tour except for Nihon Taisho-mura (Akechi town) where you will be accompanied by a guide. It is recommended to follow the time schedule listed above for an ultimate experience.
strTitle: Travel in time and discover Japan's history in Ena city,Gifu

strIntroduction: The south-east part of Gifu prefecture is rich in historical heritage sites and stunning natural scenery. The neighbouring Ena and Nakatsugawa cities share a considerable part of the old Nakasendo Road which used to connect Tokyo with Kyoto during the Edo period (17-19th century). The road winds along forested hills and beautiful river gorges and is well preserved even today. Modern day travellers can experience a real time trip by visiting the historical facilities along Nakasendo Road while enjoying the wonderful scenery in all four seasons. In this one day tour you will discover part of the Nakasendo road by strolling around the preserved post town of Magome and cycle around Oi Dam and Oi-juku. You will also have the chance to learn more about Japan's medieval history and culture, as well as to visit some stunning natural spots in Japan's countryside. This is the itinerary of the tour: Self-guided morning 10:00 am: Nakatsugawa Station (recommended train from Nagoya Station: 8:35 am local train on JR Chuo Line or 9:00 am limited express train Wide View Shinano) 10:15 am: Local bus from Nakatsugawa Station to Magome 10:40 am: Arrive at the old post town Magome, one of the stops on the Nakasendo road. Stroll the preserved stone walkways of the town and discover plenty of authentic traditional houses, small ethnographic museums and even a charming water mill. Magome's highlights are the Honjin and Wakihonjin inns (where high-level officials used to stay overnight) as well as the museum of Japan's famous writer Shimazaki Toson who was born in Magome and described life in the old town in his iconic work "Yoakemae". Have lunch in one of the pleasant little restaurants. The local soba noodles are highly recommended. 12:45 pm: Local bus from Magone to Nakatsugawa Station 13:20 pm: Local train from Nakatsugawa to Ena Station 13:31 pm: Arrive at Ena Station Guided afternoon 13:30 pm: Start of the guided cycling tour. Visit the Hiroshige Museum of Art, one of the best ukiyoe woodblock print art museums in Japan and experience the woodblock printing yourself! Next, cycle on the Nakasendo towards the Oi-juku inn, the 46th post station of the road. Visit the well-preserved Hishiya merchant house that has been turned into a cultural asset of Ena city. Cycle along the Agi River's rapid stream towards the city's iconic scenic spot Oi Dam. It was the first dam built on the Kiso River in 1924 by the famous engineer Momosuke Fukuzawa. See the wonderful scenery of serenity from the Sazanami Park, known for its cherry blossom trees and wisterias. On the way back, stop by the "Gin no Mori" restaurant and shopping complex to buy some of Ena city's famous local sweets as a souvenir. 16:00-16:30 pm: End of tour at Ena Station. Enjoy the beauty of Ena Gorge and the time trip journey to the Edo period by joining this pleasant one day tour! Note: The price does not include train and bus transportation. ※Maximum weight for cycling: 110kg.
strTitle: Walk and cycle on the old Nakasendo road: Magome, Ena Gorge

strIntroduction: Cafe & Snake is a newly opened café and the first in Japan. Run by the Tokyo Snake Center they ask you if you would like to have "teatime with a snake" Would you like to, "watch a snake?" Or even, "touch a snake?" And, if you are lucky, you may well be "healed by a snake?" And their assurance is, "We, The Tokyo Snake Center will provide you an extraordinary experience.” Cafe & Snake is located not in the suburbs, but in the middle of the big city, just a short walk from the fashionable Harajuku area! It is guaranteed that you can spend extraordinary time with the snakes. And don’t worry, all the snakes are non-poisonous. Enjoy your coffee time with the beautiful colors of your wonderful friendly new friends!
strTitle: Try the first “Snake Café” in Japan at Tokyo Snake Center!

strIntroduction: In this cooking and dining experience you will go to a sushi restaurant in Nagoya with a licensed English-speaking guide and make several different type of sushi. A professional "taisho" chef will instruct you and demonstrate his skillful sushi-making technique. You will have a delicious dinner at the restaurant too! Below is the schedule of this activity: 16:15 Pick up from one of the selected hotels 16:30 Start the sushi making experience - nigirizushi (hand-made sushi) - makizushi (rolled sushi) - see the wonderful skills of the chef 17:30 Have dinner at the sushi bar 19:00 Depart from the sushi bar 19:15 Drop back to one of the selected hotels Selected hotels available for pick-up and drop-off: Nagoya Marriott Associa Hotel Hilton Nagoya Nagoya Kanko Hotel Nagoya Tokyu Hotel The Westin Nagoya Castle Crowne Plaza Ana Grand Court Nagoya This tour is available from Monday to Saturday, except on national holidays. Participants should be 16-year-old and older. Please note that more than one group may join the same sushi-making experience program.
strTitle: Experience sushi making and enjoy a sushi dinner in Nagoya

strIntroduction: You can not on the day of the reservation. Please make a reservation at one week before. In this activity you will go to a traditional-style Japanese restaurant in central Kyoto and learn how to make "temaki-zushi" (hand-rolled sushi) in a day! A professional chef will instruct you! Below is the schedule of the activity: - gather at Sanjo-Keihan Station at 11:40 am - go to the restaurant and start the cooking class at 12:00 pm. - learn the cook hand-rolled sushi - eat the hand-rolled sushi with as much miso soup and tea as you want! We will send you photos of the meeting place the day before the activity takes place. This activity is held on Tuesdays and Thursdays at 12:00 pm. You can not on the day of the reservation. Please make a reservation at one week before
strTitle: 40% OFF Take a hand-roll sushi cooking lesson in Kyoto

strIntroduction: Celebrate the holidays or seasonal events together with Japanese locals and other foreigners at a private mansion. Please bring seasonal holiday food and any kind of drinks. You can cook at the kitchen too. Let's try some traditional Japanese holiday activities too! This party is offered on weekends or holidays from 19:00 to 23:00 (you can join and leave any time) in a luxury private mansion in central Tokyo. This activity is usually offered as a group tour with other locals and foreigners.
strTitle: Have fun at a potluck party in a luxury mansion in Tokyo

strIntroduction: This activity is a "gokon" (match making party) on Friday before St. Valentine's day. Japanese Valentine's Day is unique with the fact that girls give chocolate to boys. So, why don't we bring chocolate to give to the boys! This activity is offered not only on St. Valentine's day, but occasionally (monthly) on other days too, particularly on Friday or Satruday from 20:00 to 23:00 (you can join and leave any time). I will take you to some of Tokyo's hottest nightlife areas where we will drink together and enjoy the night. We will attend different bars every night. Here is a list of my recommendations: World Highballm Midpark Cafe, Hachienda Del Cielo in Daikanyama, Rigoletto in Roppongi Hills, Blacklist Afterwork Party at 1967, What the dickens British bar in Ebisu, Buri standing bar in Ebisu, 6th by Oriental Hotel, Waterfront Canal Cafe, Aoyama Craft Beer Market at United Nations University, Public Viewing at sports bar, Oak Door in Grand Hyatt, Roof Top Bar in Andaz on the 52nd foor at Toranomon Hills, Yonayona Kitchen at Omohara Beer Forest at Omotesando, Happy Hour at Peter the bar at the Peninsula on the 24th floor, Resort bar Cicada in Omotesando, Brew Dog Brewery in Roppongi, Spring Valley Brewery in Daikanyama, and many more! This activity is offered as a group tour with other locals and foreigners.
strTitle: Join a match-making party for St Valentine's in Tokyo

strIntroduction: In this activity you can dress up in a kimono. I only offer kimono for men, and unfortunately women and children cannot dress up but they can still participate in the tea ceremony. Shibuya is a bustling neighbourhood for teenagers and is all about pop culture, but there are some relaxing Japanese-style rooms as well. My style of tea ceremony is very casual. Generally we Japanese are a little scared when it comes to tea ceremony, because some experts in this field can tell you off if you do anything wrong. However in my activity you can be completely relaxed. I will explain the proper conduct during a tea ceremony if you want to know. Below is the example schedule of this activity: 13:00 Meet up at Shibuya Station. Going to the tea ceremony room. 13:15 Changing clothes and putting on kimono (for men only). 13:30 Taking pictures 13:45 Holding the tea ceremony 14:45 Experience making matcha tea on your own 15:15 Changing clothes 15:30 End of the activity and going back to Shibuya Station together. Alternatively, I can pick you up from your hotel but you will have to pay for the taxi. Enjoy Japanese tea ceremony in a casual atmosphere with me!
strTitle: Experience a Japanese Tea Ceremony in Shibuya, Tokyo

strIntroduction: Kichi guesthouse is located in Nakijin, Okinawa, which is also where the remains of the World Heritage castle, Nakijin Castle, can be found. There are also beaches and parks you can visit and relax. The host family is so talented that they play music at a restaurant next to the guesthouse. You can enjoy the local food, drinks and local music at night. During the day, a variety of activity options are provided. These include making traditional Okinawa sweets (Sataandagi), which are like doughnuts. After making them you can take the recipe back home. Sanshin is a traditional guitar with 3 strings with a body covered in snake skin. It will be fun to feel the snake skins texture and to play the strings. Okinawa’s own traditional kimono is called the Ryuso and is a little different from the general type that you will have become familiar with from your guidebook. The final experience involves Shishi, which is a Japanese lion and which you can see throughout Okinawa and is used for dancing, much like the traditional Chinese Dragon costumes. In Okinawa the Shishi is also considered a talisman. In each event experience there will be many photo opportunities. What makes Kichi guesthouse special is that when you stay there you will be only guest staying there on the day, because there is only one guest per day! So come and experience this unique and special opportunity to stay in Nakijin, Okinawa! Details: Check-in 15:00 Check-out 10:00 Options 1. 1 night 2 days + Okinawa Sweet Making (Sataandagi) (adult) 2. 1 night 2 days + Okinawa Sweet Making (Sataandagi) (child) 3. 1 night 2 days + Sanshin/Ryuso/Shishi experience (adult) 4. 1 night 2 days + Sanshin/Ryuso/Shishi experience (child)
strTitle: Experience Okinawa’s traditions at guest house Kichi!

strIntroduction: Revere the amazing temples and shrines in the ancient city of Kamakura on a one-day trip. Kamakura is conveniently located within an hours distance from Tokyo and is home to one of Japan’s best attractions and most famous icons the Great Buddha. The highlight of the trip and the first its first stop, the Great Buddha was completed almost a thousand years ago, in 1252 after almost a decade of construction. Over the course of 200 years many wooden builders were constructed to protect the great statue, however, many times they were destroyed by storms. Ever since the Great Buddha had remained in its present unprotected state. Next the tour will move to Hase temple where there stands a buddhist Kannon with 11-faces and 1000-arms. After wondering at the complexity of the Kannon the tour will rest for lunch near to Kamakura-station before moving on to Jomyoji Temple. At Jomyoji Temple there is a traditional Japanese dry-rock-garden. At Hokokuji Temple you enjoy a bamboo garden where you can enjoy being served green tea. Tsurugaoka Hachiman Shrine,was built in 1063, and houses the enshrined legendary Emperor Ojin, and who is still the Shinto God of War. The patron of the shrine was shogun Minamoto Yoritomo and it served as the top shrine of the Minamoto family. Finally, before returning bak to Tokyo you will be able to enjoy shopping along Komachi-dori, a shopping street lined with many small shops
strTitle: Revere Kamakura, on an Ancient City one-day-trip

strIntroduction: This two hour experience will start with a Shimakin meal at the Shimakin restaurant in Kagurazaka where one of only five known performers in Japan will perform for guests. The Shimakin meal itself consists of traditional Japanese dishes presented in red and black lacquered boxes. In addition to tofu, the highlight is the exquisite Japanese eel, an expensive delicacy of Japan. The performance master will also perform a various songs such as a love songs, ballads and folk songs accompanied by the sound of the shamisen. The restaurant itself is over 140 years old and able to accommodate up to 72 guests at each sitting in addition to a tea room in the basement. At Shimakin Kagurazaka, you can feel and enjoy the beauty of Japanese culture and the four seasons from sublime furniture, the dishes with seasonal ingredients, together with a traditional performance. Schedule: Show time: 12:00 to 14:00 Schedule: 11:50 Gathering point at 3F in Kagurazaka "Shimakin" restaurant. 12:00 Meal is served 12:30 Performance Part One 13:00 Break 13:10 Performance Part Two 13:50 Estimated termination time for the show
strTitle: Watch Traditional Japanese Performance and Banquet in Tokyo!

strIntroduction: Shodoshima is located in the middle of Seto Inland Sea. And it has beautiful beaches and mountains. Because of the mild climate, Shodoshima is famous for its olives, tangerines and small peaches. Soy source making is also one of the major industries as well. The boat captain is from Shodoshima and very familiar with the area and the tour company is community based. They will try their best to meet your requests. Why don't you try their tour! Below are the cruising options for this adventure: 1. Cruising tour for adults and children over 12 years old Once you get on the boat, you will wear a life jacket. The boat will quickly speed up and take you to the first spot, a lighthouse. From there, the boat will take you around the island . When it stops in the bay, you will be able to see fish swimming under the boat. If you like, you can get off the boat at the studio park, or at one of the famous Japanese movie spots, or the beach, and enjoy the breeze back to the port. Duration: 1.5 hours Weekdays 10:00-11:30 / 13:00-14:30 Weekends 13:00-14:30 / 15:00-16:30 (Including public holidays) Period : Every day 2. Cruising tour for children under 11 years old ※Same as Option number 1 Duration : 1.5 hours Weekdays 10:00-11:30 / 13:00-14:30 Weekends 13:00-14:30 / 15:00-16:30 (Including public holidays) Period : Every day 3. Shodoshima Mankitsu (Fully enjoy) 2-day tour <Day1> Visit famous sightseeing spots on the island. (Angel road, Rice fields, Kabuki and more) Later enjoy the local cuisine at your hotel and rest. You can choose your hotel which will include 2 meals. <Day2> All your choice! Example plans are: -More sightseeing -Fishing experience -Short trek to the mountains -Olive picking More options are available depending on the season. Please discuss with the coordinator before the trip. The tour guide will bring you to the port to conclude the tour. Duration : 1 night 2 days Period : Every day Number of attendees: Maximum 6 people Note that all cruises depart from Shodoshima Island. You can access the island by various ferries and high-speed boats from Shin-Okayama, Uno, Himeji, Hinase, Kobe or Takamatsu.
strTitle: Enjoy a cruising tour to Shodoshima!

strIntroduction: Ikaho Onsen in Gunma orefecture, is located near Mt. Haruna, at an elevation of 700 meters and was founded around the seventh century and even appears in the Manyoshu, which is the oldest form of collected poetry in Japan. A well known landmark of Ikaho Onsen are the 365 stone steps leading up from the main street, known as Ishidangai, which each represent a single day of the year. It is surrounded by traditional souvenir shops, restaurants, hotels, and shooting galleries which create the unique atmosphere of the town. Ikaho Onsen has two types of hot springs, one is "Kogane no Yu" or golden hot spring, in which iron is oxidized to form its brown color. The second is "Shirogane no Yu" or silver water, and was recently discovered. If you prefer to enjoy the healing water in private, then a private room with its own hot spring is highly recommended. In addition to the its various attractive sight seeing spots, visiting Kajika-bashi (Kajika Bridge) and The Ikaho Shrine, one of the three major historical shrines of ancient Gunma, would make a pleasant few hours stroll. Kajika-bashi is a vermillion colored lacquered-arch-bridge and in fall, the autumn coloured leaves around it create a breathtaking view and is especially beautifully when illuminated at night. Schedule: [1st day] -Travel from Shinjuku to Ikaho Onsen -Check in at a hotel (15:00-) -Enjoy taking a bath or strolling around. -Stay in a Japanese style or Japanese Western style room [2nd day] -Check out of your hotel -Return to Shinjuku (Tokyo) You can chose between various levels of luxury and regular ryokans.
strTitle: Unwind at Ikaho Onsen overnight stay from Tokyo!

strIntroduction: Katsuura Onsen, in Wakayama prefecture, is located on the southeast coast of the Kii Peninsula. Katsuura is known as a port town and also as a hot spring resort. There are several mega hotels with hot spring spa along the coastline where picturesque natural scenery is created by the ocean and islands. The port is famous for catching the largest quantity of tuna in Japan allowing you to taste various types of tuna dishes such as sashimi, fried tuna, tuna hamburgers and more. That makes the Tuna Market near Kii-Katsuura Station well worth visiting in early morning to see bidding for fresh tuna caught by Katsuura's fisherman. Katsuura and the Kii Peninsula are also a famous area for whaling. There is a whale museum offering a wide range of information about Japanese whaling culture in neaby Taiji. If you visit there from late April to the end of September, you will have the chance to experience whale watching , swimming with dolphins, and scuba diving in the neighboring towns. Schedule: [1st day] -Travel from Osaka/Kyoto to Kii-Katsuura -Check in at a hotel (15:00-18:00) -Enjoy taking a bath or strolling around. -Stay at a Japanese style or Japanese Western style room [2nd day] -Check out before 10:00 -Back from Kii-Katsuura to Osaka/Kyoto You can chose between various levels of luxury and regular ryokans.
strTitle: Relax on Katsuura Onsen overnight stay from Osaka/Kyoto!

strIntroduction: Shirahama Onsen in Wakayama prefecture is one of Japan's three oldest hot spring resorts along with Dogo Onsen in Ehime prefecture and Arima Onsen in Hyogo prefecture. Shirahama Onsen has 1300 years of history, and, since the hot spring was founded, various class of visitors from the nobility to the common people have enjoyed staying there. There are many old literary texts written about Shirahama Onsen. The word "Shirahama" means "white sandy beach" in Japanese and originated from nearby Shirarahama Beach, which is famous for its white sandy beach and established a good will sister beach relationship with Waikiki Beach (Honolulu, Hawaii, US) recently. Shrahama Onsen was once considered a mysterious hot spring because there was believed to be no evidence of a volcano around the beach. However, resent research has proven that the hot spring is generated from a water pool near the Earth's mantle deep inside of the ground! There are various types of hot springs to enjoy such as atmospheric public baths, foot baths to soak your feet, and "rotenburo" or outdoor baths. Some hotels or inns even provide outdoor baths which have ocean views. A private room is highly recommended for you to enjoy a hot spring experience with you partner or family alone. Strolling along the beach is also especially recommended before nightfall as the sun sets around Takashima Island, and one of the best places to view the sunset in the entire prefecture. Tour schedule; [1st day] -Travel from Osaka or Kyoto to Shirahama -Check in at a hotel -Enjoy taking a bath or strolling around. -Stay at a Japanese style or Japanese Western style room [2nd day] -Back from Shirahama to Osaka or Kyoto (Check out time depends on hotel and your tour) Choose between a luxury or a regular-style ryokan.
strTitle: Experience Shirahama Onsen, overnight stay from Osaka/Kyoto!

strIntroduction: Arima onsen, to the north of Mt. Rokko in Kobe, is one of Japan's oldest hot spring resorts along with Dogo Onsen in Ehime prefecture, and Shirahama Onsen in Wakayama prefecture. The hot spring has a history of over one thousand and is located just 1 hour away from Osaka, and 1.5 hours away from Kyoto, and is therefore a very convenient place for short trips. According to mythology, it is said that Arima Onsen was founded by ancient gods. One day, when the gods passed the by, they noticed three injured crows bathing in a puddle. After a few days they were completely cured because the puddle was a hot spring with the ability to cure injuries and sickness. The quality of spring water in Arima Onsen is quite unique because its origin is not from a volcano as is usually the case! Instead its water comes from cracks deep inside the ground and is therefore full of natural elements. There are two types of hot spring water which spring up at various places around the town. One is known as "Kinsen" (Golden hot spring) and the other is known as “Ginsen" (Silver hot spring). The Golden hot spring is coloured brown due to salt and iron deposits, and said to be effective for skin ailments and muscle pain. The Silver hot spring water is clear, containing radium and carbonate, and is said to be able to cure body tissue, various muscle and joint ailments, and also to enhance natural healing abilities. Visitors or guests can enjoy those two hot springs by bathing at public bath houses or at their ryokan (Japanese style hotel). Rokkosen Ropeway also attracts visitors to Arima Onsen. The view from the top of Mt. Rokko is amazing especially at night. The schedule for this experience is below; [Overnight stay] 1st day -Travel from Osaka or Kyoto to Arima (1-1.5h) -Check in at a hotel -Enjoy taking a bath or strolling around. -Overnight Stay at a Japanese or a Western style room and have a delicious Japanese course dinner 2nd day -Have breakfast -Return to Osaka from Kinosaki (Check out time depends on the hotel and your tour) [Day trip] 1st day -Travel from Osaka or Kyoto to Arima (1-1.5h) -Check in at a hotel and rest at your room -Enjoy a delicious Japanese lunch or dinner -Enjoy taking a bath or strolling around. -Return to Osaka from Kinosaki (Check out time depends on your hotel and your tour) You can chose between various levels of luxury and regular ryokans.
strTitle: Explore Arima Onsen, from Osaka or Kyoto!

strIntroduction: In this activity you will learn how to make traditional Japanese sweets wagashi and how to eat them with Uji matcha (high-quality green tea). This is an excellent cultural activity during your visit to Tokyo! Wagashi Making： Experience wagashi making! With the instructions from Ms. Wakui who is skilled in wagashi making, you will be guided to make one or two wagashi sweets. (2.5 hours) Then try wagashi and Uji matcha tea. You are invited to a enjoy a wagashi sweet with Uji matcha tea prepared in a traditional style. (30 minutes) Location： Wagashi master’s classroom in Toritsu-Daigaku, Tokyo. Meeting Place： Toritsu-Daigaku Station. Your interpreter will be there to take you to the class. Duration: 3 hours Class size: 2-6 people Souvenirs： You may take the wagashi sweets that you made in the class (two of each kind) * Wagashi can be stored at room temperature for one to three days. (It varies depending on the ingredients used. Please check with the instructor.) Photos taken during class will be provided later over the internet.
strTitle: Enjoy Wagashi Making with Uji Matcha Tea!

strIntroduction: Discover the attractions of Japan's bustling capital and take a day-trip to Hakone to see picture perfect views of Mt. Fuji The itinerary is as follows: Day 1: Arrival Door-to-door shuttle shall pick you up at either Narita or Haneda Airport and transfer you to your accommodation (must be within central Tokyo) Day 2: Tokyo Walking Tour (8 hours) English-speaking guide shall pick you up at your accommodation and will take you to some of Tokyo's top sights and neighborhoods: - Imperial Palace Area. You will be able to see the famous Nijubashi bridge, visit Imperial Palace East Gardens (closed on Mondays and Fridays). Stroll around Marunouchi Area. - Shinjuku. One of Tokyo's busiest districts. Climb up to the 45th floor of Tokyo Metropolitan Tower to see aerial views of the city. - Shibuya. A popular place for Tokyo's youth. See the famous Hachiko Statue and experience the "scramble", crossing Shibuya's crowded pedestrian. - Harajuku. Tokyo's center of fashion and youth culture. Visit the shops at Takeshita Dori and Omotesando. Stroll around Meiji Shrine or stop-by at Yoyogi Park where you can see street performances on weekends. * There will be no private transportation for this tour but instead, we shall provide you with a one-day subway pass to get around and visit different places in Tokyo. After the tour, you may still use the subway pass for self-guided sightseeing or shopping around. * We do not guarantee that you will be able to visit all places that are listed above. It will depend on your own pace and preference. Considering that you need to ride public transportation, there may be some delays that may occur. The guide shall only be accompanying you for 8 hours. Day 3: Tsukiji and Asakusa Walking Tour (8 hours) English-speaking guide shall pick you up at your accommodation. Together, you will take the subway to reach Tsukiji Fish Market, one of the largest wholesale market in the world. Explore the market and check out today’s fresh catch. Afterwards, free time shall be given for you to take lunch in the area (guests must buy and pay for their own lunch). After lunch, stroll around Hama Rikyu, one of Tokyo's best landscape gardens. From Hama Rikyu, you shall be taking a river waterbus along the Sumida River to reach Asakusa. Upon reaching Asakusa, visit Sensoji Temple, the oldest temple in Tokyo, see Kaminarimon Gate and shop for souvenirs at Nakamise shopping street. Day 4: Hakone Day Tour (~ 10 hours) Guide shall pick you up at your hotel and together, you shall be taking the Romance Car (Limited Express train) from Shinjuku to Hakone. At Hakone, take the Hakone Ropeway to enjoy Hakone's scenic views. Stop-by at Owakudani, a volcanic area where you can try boiled eggs, cooked using volcanic waters. This is also one of the best areas to catch a perfect view of Mount Fuji on a clear day. Continuing the tour, you shall proceed to Lake Ashi and board a pirate cruise ship that will take you across the lake. Have a leisurely time exploring the sights around the area. After the tour, return to Shinjuku by train. Note: When time permits, you may also visit Hakone Shrine or Odawara Castle (admission fees must be paid separately) Day 5*: Departure A door-to-door shuttle service shall pick you up form your hotel at a designated time and transfer you to either Haneda or Narita Airport. Note: In case you plan to stay in Tokyo for more that 5 days, this transfer can also be done at a later day. What this tour includes: - round-trip airport transfers - private English-speaking guides - entrance fees and transportation expenses* Note: For entrance fees, we only cover those that are included in this itinerary. It may be possible that there are other attractions that you would like to visit during the tour. Time permitting, you may do so provided that you pay for the extra entrance and transportation fees for you and your guide. *Booking must be made two (2) weeks prior to the tour
strTitle: Tokyo Guided Tour - 5 day Affordable Package

strIntroduction: Kinosaki onsen, located in northern part of Hyogo prefecture, is known as the one of the best hot spring resort towns in Japan. The hot springs in Kinosaki were founded around the 8th century. Since then, the town has developed into an attractive hot spring resort and one that was awarded two stars by "Michelin Green Guide Japon" (French edition) as a "Place to visit on a side trip”. There are many hot springs in Kinosaki Onsen. Seven public hot springs are the most famous and guests or visitors of Kinosaki can feel at home strolling about the town in yukata (summer cotton Kimono) and geta (wooden clogs), enjoying charming the beautiful atmosphere. There are also many attractive places to visit nearby such as Kinosaki Onsen Ropeway, Genbudo Caves, Konotori (Oriental White Stork) Park, Kinosaki Marine World, and many more easily accessible by using rental bikes. And, if you're lucky, Kinosaki Onsen has another unique feature, festivals! Danjiri (portable shrine) festivals, or Kinosaki “Shrine Fighting” Festival is the most famous. There are fireworks every night in summer. Many other festivals are held in each season, so please check the schedule before your visit to Kinosaki. The schedule of this tour is below. [1st day] -Travel from Osaka to Kinosaki Onsen by train -Check in at a hotel (15:00-18:00) -Enjoy taking bath or strolling around. -Stay at Japanese style or Japanese Western style room [2nd day] -Check out before 11:00 -Back from Kinosaki to Osaka You can chose between various levels of luxury and regular rooms including Japanese or western style rooms with or without a private outside bath.
strTitle: Explore Kinosaki Onsen Resort and stay overnight from Osaka!

strIntroduction: Takayu Onsen is a small and traditional hot spring resort area located in Mt. Azuma near Fukushima city. Takayu Onsen is well known for its long history, fresh whitish blue sulfuric waters, and quiet environment. If you are tired of the crowded city, this is a great place to simply relax and heal your body and mind. Over 400 years old, Takayu Onsen has attracted people seeking "touji" (using hot springs for medical treatment). With plenty of spring water piped from the ground in the Takayu Onsen area, all bathes offer natural spring water containing rich sulfur that will make your skin beautiful. While many hot spring resorts have developed into entertainment districts, Takayu Onsen has kept a for over 400 years, "Value the hot spring and let their guests enjoy it", thus avoiding unnecessary development. Just 2 km away from the resort within a short hiking distance you can find Fudou Fall where you will enjoy fresh air and green leaves in summer, and red autumn leaves in fall. This tour includes transport (Shinkansen bullet train) from Tokyo to Fukushima Station, pick up from Fukushima to your hotel, and over night stay. There are 2 options to choose from, fitting your wishes and budget. The schedule is below: [1st day] -Travel from Tokyo to Fukushima -Check in at a hotel (15:00-18:00) Free pick up service from Fukushima station at 15:15, reservation is mandatory. -Enjoy taking bath or strolling around. -Stay at Japanese style or Japanese Western style room [2nd day] -Check out before 10:00 -Back from Fukushima to Tokyo You can chose between various levels of luxury and regular rooms.
strTitle: Bathe in Takayu Onsen and stay overnight, from Tokyo!

strIntroduction: Nanao City in Ishikawa prefecture, located about 5 hours by Shinkansen and JR train from Tokyo, is a town of hot springs known as Wakura Onsen and a place where you can enjoy delicious dishes of fresh products from the ocean and mountains. Located beside Nanao Bay on the Noto Peninsula, it is also known as one of the best high-class hot spring resorts in Japan and as the "ocean's hot spring." The resort town is dominated by massive ryokan complexes along the water's edge. There is a public square (hiroba) with a hot spring water fountain and a small park around a shrine and a hot spring source with water pipes. A few free foot baths (ashiyu) can also be found around town. The hot springs have had many visitors and developed into a great spa resort. Drift off to another world as you sink into the hot spring waters. Wakura Onsen’s greatest attraction must be found in its plentiful volume of hot water and excellent location by the sea that allows you to relax and bath in nature's beauty. Clear hot waters, filtered by crystals contained in underground granite, never stop flowing. The water is said to have benefits for neuralgia, muscle aches, joint aches, stiff shoulders, chronic digestive diseases, piles, intolerance to cold, chronic skin diseases, frail children, and chronic female disorders, etc. As you soak in the bath, you will ease your heart, mind and soul. Release all the stress and tiredness accumulated from your journey, and warm yourself to the core. Our options, fitting your wishes and budget, include an overnight stay and round trip by Shinkansen and JR train from Tokyo. There is also a free pick-up service from Wakura Onsen station, but if you want to use the service, you need to make a reservation. You can chose between various levels of luxury and regular rooms including Japanese style rooms with private outside bath.
strTitle: Wash Away your Aches with an overnight stay in Wakura Onsen!

strIntroduction: Located in Izu area, to the southeast of Japan’s most famous mountain, Mount Fuji, Atami Onsen is one of the best hot spring resorts in Japan. Because of the easy access from Tokyo (50 min.) as well as from Osaka (150 min) by bullet train, many tourists visit here for sightseeing and relaxation throughout the year. As a resort town, Atami has a long history. Tokugawa Ieyasu, the founder and first shogun of the Edo shogunate from 1603 came here for a hot spring cure, which triggered Atami to gain popularity throughout the country. The first prime minister and political leaders in the Meiji period also visited, holding ministerial meetings. In the Showa era, Atami became the most popular honeymoon resort for newly married couples as a result of the opening of the Tokaido Shinkansen. Atami Baien is famous for Japanese plum flowers which reach full bloom in early spring. "Atami Geigi Kenban" is the place where local geisha dance in their kimono every Saturday and Sunday. You can also enjoy tropical gardens and shopping and at Hatsushima Island Resort on Hatsushima Island which is just a 20 minutes ferry ride away. We offer you an overnight stay tour with round trip on Shinkansen. Given good weather, you can see beautiful Mt. Fuji from the train window! As for the accommodation, there are some options depending on budget and facilities. See the details below. You can choose between: - Staying at a luxury ryokan (standard Japanese style room, or Japanese style room with private open air bath) - Staying at a resort hotel with oceanic view (Japanese-Western style room, or Junior Suite with private open air bath) - You can also purchase transportation ticket as an option.
strTitle: Experience the Wonder of Relaxation in Atami Onsen!

strIntroduction: Ginzan Onsen is a secluded town located in the mountains of Yamagata prefecture and originally developed around a silver mine. Nowadays it is known as one of the most beautiful hot spring towns in Japan. Its traditional townscape of wooden buildings with brilliant woodwork and white plaster walls make you feel like you are in a bygone era. Along the river and running through the Ginzan Onsen, are a number of historic ryokan, there is a place where you can enjoy a foot-bath. Stroll around the city, and when you get tired drop by and refresh! With its beautiful Japanese architecture, you can enjoy the seasonal change of the scenery and in spring the sight and smell of cherry blossom are unforgettable. The natural colours of summer, striking colours of autumn leaves and traditional townscape covered with snow in winter make for a constantly changing view. At night, these views are lit up by the lights of ryokan's adding to the drama of nature! A short 10-15 minute walk along a nature trail up into the valley will lead you to a peek at the former silver mine and one of the most famous spots to visit around the area and will make your trip all the more memorable. You can chose between various levels of luxury and regular rooms. The package includes round trip transportation from Tokyo.
strTitle: Stroll around a Silver Mining Town and enjoy Ginzan Onsen

strIntroduction: Nasu is located in northern Tochigi prefecture, about 180 kilometers north from Tokyo. Not far from the city, Nasu Kogen is a highland popular place to get away from the summer heat and is also well-known for housing the Imperial family’s summer villa. Blessed with an abundance of nature and beautiful scenery, Nasu Kogen is also filled with many excellent places for visitors such as leisure facilities, art museums, farms and zoos. Feel the nature, and after that, why don’t you enjoy the high quality onsen? There are two big onsen areas around Nasu Kogen: Nasu Onsen and Shiobara Onsen. Nasu Onsen-kyo are scattered all over the foot of Mt. Chausu, the main peak of the Nasu Mountains. The origin of the Onsen-kyo comes from a legend known as “Shikanoyu” from the 7th century. The legend of “Shikanoyu” (deer’s bath) claims that an injured deer soaked in the hot spring and healed her wound which has the onsen famous as a therapeutic retreat ever since! Shiobara Onsen is a hot spring town, located along a forested valley twenty kilometers south of Mount Nasudake. Although Shiobara Onsen is fairly developed with several large hotels, it is surrounded by woods and mountains which lend it a decidedly rustic feel. The town's collection of hot spring baths, waterfalls and hiking trails help to contribute to the feeling of being close to nature. Drift off to another world as you sink into the hot spring waters. As you soak in an open-air bath, you will ease your heart, mind and soul. Release all the stress and tiredness accumulated from your journey, and warm yourself to the core. A private bath is recommended for couples. You can chose between various levels of luxury and regular rooms including Japanese style rooms with private outside bath. The accommodation will be either in Nasu Onsen or in Shiobara Onsen.
strTitle: Enjoy Overnight Stay at Nasu Mountains Onsen, Tochigi!

strIntroduction: Hirayu Onsen in Gifu prefecture is surrounded by an abundance of nature where you can experience the contrasts of the changing seasons. The steaming waters of the hot spring are different depending on each hot spring pool. Medicinal benefits of the hot springs are varied. The natural waters are said to be good for rashes on the body, stiff shoulders, and even poor digestion. Around Hirayu Onsen there are many natural sightseeing spots. Depending on the season there are pink cherry blossom, green fresh verdure, deep red and yellow autumn leaves, or a white carpet of snow. With the setting of the sun, many of these places are lit-up, adding to their awe and offering innumerable photo opportunities. Highly recommended places to visit are, Hirayu Ohtaki Park, where you can enjoy the local cuisine set against the backdrop of beautiful nature. An amazing 64 meter-high waterfall is set against autumn leaves in fall, and is frozen over in winter and lit-up after dark, offering fantastical imagery, and can even be viewed whist dipping your feet into a foot-bath below. And finally, don't forget to taste Hida Beef Japans top ranked! It is beyond expression! You can chose between various levels of luxury and regular rooms. The package includes round trip transportation from Tokyo.
strTitle: Stay overnight in Hirayu Onsen, a trip from Tokyo

strIntroduction: While you're in Japan for the New Years, why don't you celebrate the New Year the Japanese way. Let us teach you all about it! Your English speaking guide will meet you at Nagoya Station in the morning and take you to Atsuta Shrine, one of the three most significant shrines in the country, for New Year prayers and other ceremonies. There you will learn about various New Year traditions, such as Omamori, which are various religious lucky chars or protections. You will also learn about the twelve symbols used to symbolize the New Year and also about the things Japanese people do to celebrate it. After Atsuta shrine we will have a traditional New Years lunch of Soba or Osechi, which are traditional wooden lunch boxes divided into various parts for a variety of foods. Finally, we will take you to the main shopping area of Nagoya and teach you how to shop for a popular New Years item, Fukubukuro (a bag with a secret selection of goods inside). From here you can dive into the shopping madness of New Year sales and lucky bags! Have a Happy New Year! This tour is available only between January 3 and 10.
strTitle: Celebrate New Year the Japanese Way at a Shrine

strIntroduction: Have fun picking fruits of your choice at a local farm. All you can eat! Boost your immune system with a day outdoors and a super-shot of vitamins from cannot-get-any-fresher-than-that strawberries. Start the tour at Nagoya station by taking a local train towards the farm. After arrival at the station the farm staff will pick you up and drive you to the farm where you will enjoy a delicious barbecue lunch and all-you-can-eat fruit picking experience. At the end of the session, you will get a ride back to the train station and return to Nagoya. This is a self-guided tour. You will receive transportation instructions to your e-mail at the time of booking. Fruit picking seasons are: May-July: cherries June-August: melons June-September: peaches July-August: blueberries July-October: grapes September-October: pears September-December: apples October-January: mandarin oranges Some other picking experiences include: bamboo shoots, shiitake mushrooms, chestnuts, kiwis, and sweet potatoes.
strTitle: Pick Fruit and Feast on a Fabulous BBQ

strIntroduction: Located along the Tone River coming down from the Tanigawa mountain range, Minakami Onsen in Gunma is one of the nearest hot spring resorts to Tokyo. Many famous literary figures, such as Osamu Dazai, Bokusui Wakayama, and Hakushu Kitahara visited here and loved its abundant nature and hot spring baths. Sulfate springs in Minakami are said to be good for rheumatism, nervous system disorder, chronic constipation, stomach troubles, as well as easing many characteristic problems of feminine ailments. Nowadays outdoor people flock to this area for adventurous activities. They enjoy whitewater rafting, canyoning, and canoeing in spring and summer and devote themselves to snowshoeing, skiing and snowboarding in winter, which makes Minakami a-year-round outdoor sports destination. The alpine scenery of mountains like Mt. Tanigawadake, Mt. Hotaka, and Mt. Shibutsu is one of the highlights in Minakami. The Tanigawadake Ropeway takes you to the summit for hiking, colorful autumn leaves, or just enjoying the superb mountain views. There are some options depending on budget, transportation and facilities. For couples, we recommend you a ryokan room with a private open air bath. You can choose between: - Staying at luxury ryokan (standard Japanese style room, or Japanese style room with a private open air bath) - Staying at standard hotel (Japanese style room) - You can also purchase transportation ticket as an option. ◆Price includes: - Overnight stay in a ryokan or hotel room - Dinner and breakfast - Hot spring baths (except for cleaning time) - Towels, and the cotton kimono "yukata"
strTitle: Warm your body and soul in Minakami Onsen hot spring!

strIntroduction: Manza Onsen is a hot spring resort town within the Joshinetsu Kogen National Park in Gunma Prefecture. It is called the "spa town nearest to heaven" because its located at a height of 1800 meters above sea level. The highly acidic water obtained from Mt. Shirane contains higher level of sulfur than any other place in Japan. It is effective for rheumatism, respiratory diseases, gastrointestinal disorders, and skin diseases, and even improves metabolism and blood circulation. Most hotels and ryokan in Manza Onsen offer great spring baths. Above all, an open-air bath "rotenburo" is a special treat to deliver you with fresh air and a great view of rock gardens or mountains. There are walking trails around the valley, one of which leads to a hot spring field, "yubatake" . Yubatake is a place for cooling hot water from the spring source. The trails are inaccessible during winter because of snow, however, you can enjoy skiing or snowboarding from mid December to March at the near by Manza Onsen Ski Resort. In case you are not an outdoor person, don't worry. The accommodations we prepared for this tour have several bath areas including "rotenburo" where you can spend all day long until your fingers go wrinkly! Dinner and breakfast are served in buffet-style restaurants. There are some options depending on budget and facilities. See the details below. You can choose between: - Staying at a luxury ryokan (Japanese style, Western style, or Japanese Style room with bed) - Staying at a standard hotel (Japanese style, Western style or Japanese Style room with bed) - You can also purchase transportation tickets as an option. ◆Price includes: - Overnight stay in a ryokan or hotel room for 2-4 people - Dinner and breakfast - 24 hour operated hot spring baths (except for cleaning time) - Towels, and the cotton kimono "yukata"
strTitle: Take a hot spring bath with a superb view in Manza Onsen!

strIntroduction: Located in the northwest of Gunma Prefecture, Shima Onsen is a hot spring resort along a mountain stream, Shima river. The history of Shima Onsen dates back to the end of the 10th century and is considered to be one of the oldest hot springs in Japan. The name "Shima" is "四万" in kanji characters and means forty thousand. It was said that abundant spring waters in the area could heal as many diseases as the name implies. Even now Shima Onsen continues to gain popularity among tourists because of its rustic presence and facilities; a nostalgic atmosphere of good old days, comfortable footbaths, and spots for drinking spring water make them feel at home. Some public baths here are still free of charge! So its no wonder that the national govermnent designated the area as the first resort district in Japan. In his famous animated film, "Spirited Away (Sen to Chihiro no Kamikakushi)", world famous Japanese director Hayao Miyazaki from Studio Ghibli portrayed the buildings and bridges of Shima Onsen. The district has sources of spring water as well as sources of inspiration. In this tour, Shima Onsen overnight stay from Tokyo, we book authentic Japanese style inns featuring remnants of traditional Japanese architecture and offering the best hot spring baths in town. Dinners using fresh seasonal ingredients are served in kaiseki style. Enjoy a relaxing time at historic ryokan! You can choose between: - Luxury Shima overnight stay! (Japanese style room) - Shima overnight stay! (Japanese style room) - You can also purchase transportation ticket as an option. ◆Price includes: - Overnight stay in a ryokan room - Dinner and breakfast - Hot spring baths - Towels, and the cotton kimono "yukata"
strTitle: Relax and Mellow Out in Historic Shima Onsen!

strIntroduction: Suwa is a city bordering on Lake Suwa in southern Nagano where you can immerse yourself in rich natural surroundings and history. The access is superb －only a two and half hour train ride or three hour highway bus ride from Shinjuku, Tokyo. In addition to the beautiful Lake Suwa, there are historical sites such as Takashima Castle and Suwa Taisha Shrine. Feel the history and nature, and after that why don’t you enjoy the high quality onsen? Kamisuwa Onsen is located along the east side of Lake Suwa. The hot springs have had many visitors and developed into a great spa resort. Drift off to another world as you sink into the hot spring waters. Kamisuwa Onsen is famous for its skin care qualities. The water is smooth and gentle on the skin with a light alkalinity, and is thought to help nerve pain and stiff shoulders, relieve tiredness and promote good health. As you soak in an open-air bath, you will ease your heart, mind and soul. Release all the stress and tiredness accumulated from your journey, and warm yourself to the core. A private bath is recommended for a couple. Our options, fitting your wishes and budget, include an overnight stay and round trip by bus from Tokyo. The check in time of the ryokan is between 15:00 and 19:00, and the check out time is 10:00. Choose between a regular-style and a luxury-style ryokan. The luxury ryokan has rooms with private baths too!
strTitle: Feast Your Eyes on Lake Suwa and enjoy Kamisuwa Onsen!

strIntroduction: Takayama city is one of the oldeest cities in Japan. Its historical townscape with Japanese traditional architecture is fun to look around. Along with beautiful buildings, you can enjoy seasonal scenery. Takayama city is especially famous for cherry blossoms in spring and autumn leaves in fall. Miya River runs through the middle of the city and over the river there is a red beautiful bridge. On the river banks there are cherry trees creating the most beautiful scenery. And at night you can enjoy its beauty against the backdrop of night lights. You can also enjoy this seasonal scenery while you rest in Takayama Onsen! Its natural water is good for stiffness in your muscles, sensitivity to coldness, and tiredness. After refreshing at the onsen, how about having a special meal? Here in Takayama, Hida-Beef is very famous. It is a top ranked beef in Japan. You can either enjoy it with shabu-shabu, steak, or roasted! There is also a course menu to fully enjoy the great parts of Hida-Beef and other local delicacies. There are various options to choose from. Choose the place that fits your wish and budget. To make your stay special and unique, I highly recommend you to stay overnight in Takayama Onsen!
strTitle: Stroll Around Historical Takayama and Enjoy an Onsen

strIntroduction: Gero Onsen is located in the middle of Japan. It has a history of 1000 years. It is known as "a hot spring of beauty". The origin of the name is the characteristic of its water. The water helps to wash off old keratin remaining in the skin. It makes your skin smooth and takes out the dullness from your skin. The carbonated spring bubbles up to warm your body and ease your stiffness. This is popular among women as a beauty treatment. There are many ways to enjoy Gero Onsen. You can either stay overnight at a traditional ryokan in this area, you can also go to many onsen spots and enjoy a variety of onsen hot springs. There is a passport that you can buy for 1,300 JPY to go and take a bath in 3 of the hot springs in the area. You can use this passport for 6 months, so enjoy your stay here in Gero. Gero is surrounded by nature so you can enjoy hiking and seeing famous waterfalls in this area. You can also go mountain climbing in Mt. Hidakanayama. There is also a camp site in Mt. Hidakanayama, so it's also a good idea to camp there. Gero is also famous for beautiful cherry blossoms at the beginning and during the middle of spring. There are cherry trees along the river near Gero Station and the view is sublime! There are also spots where you can see lit-up cherry blossoms. Let's also mention the food! The foods produced in this area are splendid! Among the top ranking are rice, vegetables grown with beautiful fresh water, Hida beef and fresh fish fished from the river around the Gero area. The dishes made by these local delicacies are beyond expression! There are of course many ways to enjoy Gero Onsen, fitting your wish and budget. If you can, I highly recommend you to at least add a meal here and even stay overnight at the traditional Ryokan. Choose between a regular-style and a luxury-style ryokan experience. There are rooms with private hot springs in the luxury ryokan too! Transportation from and to Tokyo is included.
strTitle: Stroll on Gero Onsen Streets and Stay Overnight, from Tokyo

strIntroduction: Nikko lies at the foot of Mt. Nyoho in the western part of Tochigi. Nikko is a town at the entrance to Nikko National Park, most famous for Toshogu, Japan's most lavishly decorated shrine and the mausoleum of Tokugawa Ieyasu, the founder of the Tokugawa shogunate. The complex of temples and shrines at Toshogu are the highlight of Nikko, and afterwards visitors can explore the mountains along Nikko's numerous hiking trails. These Nikko structures and the surrounding forest areas are registered as a UNESCO World Heritage site and an important cultural property where nature and buildings are united. If you go further to the west, you can see Lake Chuzenji and Kegon Falls, also Nikko’s famous tourist spots. Feel the history and nature, and after that why don’t you enjoy the high quality onsen? The hot springs have had many visitors and developed into a great spa resort. Drift off to another world as you sink into the hot spring waters. Nikko Onsen is famous for its skin care qualities. The water is colorless and transparent, smooth and gentle on the skin with a light alkalinity, and is thought to help nerve pain and stiff shoulders, relieve tiredness and promote good health. As you soak in an open-air bath, you will ease your heart, mind and soul. Release all the stress and tiredness accumulated from your journey, and warm yourself to the core. A private bath is recommended for couples. Our options, fitting your wishes and budget, include an overnight stay and round trip transportation from Tokyo. Choose between a luxury and a regular-style ryokan.
strTitle: Enjoy Onsen in the World Heritage Nikko!

strIntroduction: Located only 2 hours by train from Tokyo, Kinugawa Onsen was first founded approximately 300 years ago. The area has been extensively developed for tourism since 1970s, and became one of the most famous Onsen spots in Japan today. The sceneries of the gorge and mountains on the clear stream remind many Japanese of their cherished traditional homes, giving them comfort and energy. Particularly in winter, the resort offers visitors an opportunity to enjoy playing in the snow through winter sports and snow trekking. Even beginners or children can participate in, and experience the marvels of nature to the full. There are many theme parks in the area, and it is also popular for sightseeing. The hot springs have had many visitors and developed into a great spa resort. Kinugawa Onsen is famous for its skin care qualities. The soft sounds of the Kinugawa River and the scent of cypress wood suffuse the hot springs, which deeply relax and delight all of the senses. The water is smooth and gentle on the skin with a light alkalinity, and is thought to help nerve pain and stiff shoulders, relieve tiredness and promote good health. A private bath is recommended for couples. Our options, fitting your wishes and budget, include an overnight stay and round trip from Tokyo. The ryokan you will stay in is located about 10-minute away from Kinugawa Onsen station. There is also a free pick-up service from the station if you call upon arrival. Choose between a luxury or a regular-style ryokan. You can also purchase transportation ticket as an option.
strTitle: Wear a yukata and stay overnight in Kinugawa Onsen!

strIntroduction: This is a private guided one day tour in which you will explore the best historical places in Fukuoka and Dazaifu which preserve the spiritual atmosphere of pre-Edo period Japan. You will visit several iconic temples, including the first Zen temple in Japan, learn a lot about Fukuoka's traditional culture, crafts, and festivals in a local folklore museum, and take a train to visit the ancient town of Dazaifu which used to be an important administrative center about 1000 years ago.Get a flavor of Japan's southern cities in this exciting cultural tour! Below is the list of sightseeing spots that are included in this tour: - Jotenji Temple, where you can see a beautiful Zen-style rock and sand garden - Shofukuji Temple, known as the first Zen temple in Japan founded by Eisai who brought the Rinzai sect into the country - Tochoji Temple, which has a splendid five-storey pagoda and is home to Japan's largest wooden sitting Buddha - Hakata Machiya Folk Museum, a small but interesting folklore museum where you will learn more about the traditions, crafts, and popular festivals of Fukuoka - Kushida Shrine, known as the starting point of the famous Gion Yamakasa festival held every July - Canal City, a splendid shopping complex with plenty of restaurants - Komyozenji Temple in Dazaifu, a brilliant temple complex with stunningly beautiful Japanese-style gardens - Dazaifu Tenmangu Shrine, head of all Tenmangu shrines in Japan that are devoted to the spirit of the famous scholar and politician Sugawara Michizane, who lived 1000 years ago - Kyushu National Museum, a true dreamland for lovers of Japanese history and culture. The museum is closed on Mondays and instead, a visit to Dazaifu's former Government Office Ruins will be offered on those days. The tour will end back in Fukuoka. Book this tour to experience the best of Fukuoka and Dazaifu's history, architecture, and ancient culture!
strTitle: Discover the history and culture of Fukuoka and Dazaifu

strIntroduction: If you're in Fukuoka prefecture, you cannot leave it without visiting Yanagawa! Yanagawa can be visited in 50 minutes by a train ride from Fukuoka, and is a town surrounded by water with beautiful scenes of old houses and nature. Would you like to take a boat ride around the historic Yanagawa Castle as you see the charm of this old samurai town? Detailed course: (Duration: 6h) Boat riding, Ohana Museum & Japanese Garden and the shopping street *Date and time can be arranged at your request. Note: If you request pick-up from the Fukuoka Port, the actual tour duration will be shorter. Photos by: -https://flic.kr/p/5m61GZ -https://flic.kr/p/5maicC -https://flic.kr/p/4QFUmF -https://flic.kr/p/4TFRv3 -https://flic.kr/p/4TBEs6 -https://flic.kr/p/4TBCxZ
strTitle: Explore the Deep Fukuoka, City of Waterways!

strIntroduction: Dazaifu is only a half an hour train ride from Tenjin, downtown Fukuoka. Enjoy walking and learning about the area with a professional tour guide. Detailed course: (Duration: 4h) Dazaifu Tenmangu Shrine Kyushu National Museum The old temples nearby *Date and time can be arranged at your request. Don't miss this chance to visit Dazaifu! This tour promises you to make your trip unforgettable! Photos by: -https://flic.kr/p/5ALtTj -https://flic.kr/p/5ALrRh -https://flic.kr/p/i1Qzw -https://flic.kr/p/5m59Ur -https://flic.kr/p/5fSPdX -https://flic.kr/p/7tBShV
strTitle: Enjoy a walking tour in Dazaifu in Fukuoka

strIntroduction: Fukuoka is a old city known for great food, such as ramen, pollack roe flavored with chili pepper, udon, and soba. Other than the delicious food, Fukuoka is known to have many historical sites, and plays an important role in foreign exchange, as the port faces China and the Korean Peninsula. Fukuoka-city is Kyushu's largest city and is very lively. You will be riding the bus and ferry in this tour and will be eating tasty Japanese meal for lunch! Come join this tour and explore the amazing city of Fukuoka! Detailed schedule of the tour: 9:00 Meet up at Hotel Okura Fukuoka -We will proceed to Dazaifu Tenman-gu by bus. * Please arrive at least 10 minutes before the departure time. Visit Dazaifu Tenman-gu Shrine (For 60 minutes) -Dazaifu Tenman-gu Shrine is built over the grave of Michizane Sugawara, a scholar and politician of the Heian Period. Come visit this dynamic shrine and learn more about the Japanese history! Visit Kanmon Tunnel -We will be going underground to walk across Kanmon Tunnel, crossing the border of Fukuoka Prefecture and Yamaguchi Prefecture. Visit the Shimonoseki Grand Hotel -Here, you will enjoy a nice Japanese set meal with Fugu (globefish), which is a local specialty of Shimonoseki. Visit Karato Market (30 minutes) -Experience buying fresh vegetables and seafood from a local market staff! Communicate with them to know more about the seafood and vegetables that are sold in the area! The seafood stalls are open on national holidays and on every weekends! Ride the Kanmon Ferry -You will be riding the ferry from Shimonoseki to head to Moji-ko! -Moji-ko has many well preserved Westernized Buildings from the Meiji and Taisho periods. Visit Moji-ko Port -Moji-ko Port is an important international trading port ever since the late 19th century. Visit Kaikyo Dramaship (Kanmon Straits Museum) -This museum, which also features a light show, talks about the history of the Kanmon straits. -Enjoy watching the dolls, models, and dramatic movie montage here! 16:30 Return to Hakata Station by bus We will be ending the tour at Hakata Station. Come join us in this tour to explore the beautiful, entertaining city of Fukuoka! You will be surprised by what Fukuoka can offer you! We look forward to seeing you! Photo Credits: https://flic.kr/p/aq98U9 https://flic.kr/p/5m59Ur https://flic.kr/p/5AGczv https://flic.kr/p/ac3urk https://flic.kr/p/8Q15SG
strTitle: Explore Fukuoka Prefecture in One Day!

strIntroduction: Recognized as the biggest bus network established in Hokkaido, you'll experience a convenient ride to Niseko. Once you arrive you can explore other activities, which include skiing, snowboarding, taking a lift ride to the snowy mountains of Niseko, and tasting the local cuisine. You can ride the convenient bus not only from Chitose Airport, but also from hotels in central Sapporo. The buses depart once every hour from Chitose Airport, but only in the morning between 7:30 and 8:30 from Sapporo. Lastly, you should keep in mind that the bus ride averages between three to four hours. Settle in, relax, and enjoy the ride. List of Sapporo hotels available for pick-up (if your hotel is not listed, please come to the nearest hotel in the list): Hotel Clubby Sapporo (7:30) Hotel Monterey Sapporo (7:40) JR Tower Hotel Nikko Sapporo (7:50) Hotel MyStays Sapporo Aspen (8:00) Century Royal Hotel (8:10) Keio Plaza Hotel Sapporo (8:20) Ana Holiday Inn Sapporo Susukino (7:40) Sapporo Tobu Hotel (7:50) Sapporo ANA Hotel (8:00) New Otani Inn Sapporo (8:10) Sapporo Grand Hotel (8:20) Royton Sapporo (8:30) Hotel MyStays Premia Sapporo Park (7:45) Sapporo Excel Hotel Tokyu (7:55) Sapporo Tokyu Rei Hotel (8:05) Hotel Sanroute New Sapporo (8:15) Tokyo Dome Hotel Sapporo (8:25) Sapporo Prince Hotel (8:35) Drop-off point: Hirafu Daiichi Parking (11:00) The green leaf Niseko Village (11:20) Hilton Niseko Village (11:25) Niseko Northern Resort Annupuri (11:40) Hotel Kanro no Mori (11:50) Niseko Grand Hotel (11:55) Tsurugabesso Sanosho Iriguchi mae (12:00)
strTitle: Take a trip to Niseko via Ski Bus from Sapporo in Hokkaido

strIntroduction: What other activities does Niseko offer its guests besides skiing & snowboarding? Niseko Village offers its guest a variety of winter activities. If you'd like to take a break from skiing or snowboarding, then you should consider the following activities: １．Snow Rafting If you thought rafting was solely resolved for paddling down a river, then you're in for a surprise. You'll experience the difference as you ride the snowmobile at full speed through the powder snow of Niseko. Necessary information: Time: 9:30 am - 3:30 pm | Duration: 15 minutes The minimum age for participation is 3-year-old. ２．Horse Riding After a long day, you can experience the freedom of riding a horse while taking in the view of the snowy fields. Necessary information: Time: 10:00 am - 3:00 pm | Duration: 5 minutes | December 20, 2016 - March 13, 2017 The minimum age for participation is 4-year-old. ３．Cross-country Ski Rental You don't need to stress about not owning/bringing your own gear in order to participate in cross-country since there's a rental service. In addition, a special course is offered for those interesting in cross-country. Necessary information: Time: 9:30 am - 4:00 pm | Opened: January - Middle of March (Depending on the amount of snow.) ４．Reindeer sledding Who says you can't experience the life of Santa? Take a seat on the sled and explore Niseko with the reindeer's - though, you may not be able to fly across Hokkaido. Time: 10:00 am - 3:00 pm | Duration: 5 minutes | Opened: December 20, 2016 - February 21, 2017 The minimum age for participation is 3-year-old.
strTitle: Explore Four Off the Beaten Path Activities in Niseko

strIntroduction: Niseko has captured the attention of locals and travelers alike through its abundance of light powder snow, highest snowfalls in Japan (average of over 17 meters), long ski runs, backpackers, after-ski activities, and English friendly environment. One of the most important aspects that skiers and snowboards appreciate about Niseko is its powder snow. If you're unfamiliar with the difference, powder is a fresh, untouched, soft snow; this forms a smooth surface to ski through and land on, rather than crud or compact snow. The type of snow can make the difference between having a great or good experience. As vast as Niseko is, you have the option of choosing from the three most popular ski resorts located on Mount Niseko: Hirafu offers the most variety by being the largest resort. Niseko offers higher slopes, while Annupuri offers a less crowded environment. Choose your preference and embark on a whole new adventure. The package includes the following routes: Hirafu (6-hour lift riding ticket included & return transport): １． Sapporo-Hirafu-Sapporo ２． Sapporo-Hirafu-Chitose airport ３． Chitose airport-Hirafu-Sapporo Niseko (8-hour lift riding ticket included & return transport): 1． Sapporo-Niseko Village-Sapporo 2． Sapporo-Niseko Village-Chitose airport 3． Chitose airport-Niseko Village-Sapporo 4． Sapporo-All Niseko area-Sapporo 5． Sapporo-All Niseko area-Chitose airport 6． Chitose airport-All Niseko area-Sapporo The duration of the above journey range between three to four hours, depending on the location of the hotel you booked. During pick-up, you'll receive a ticket which can be exchanged for your lift riding ticket after arrival. This lift riding ticket will be accepted at 4 places listed below: ・Niseko HANAZONO Resort ・Niseko Grand Hirafu ・Niseko Village Resort ・Niseko Annupuri International Ski Hill On a final note, you can enjoy the hot springs after a long day tackling the powder snow of Niseko.
strTitle: Venture Out & Take a Trip to Niseko Ski Resort from Sapporo

strIntroduction: Have you ever heard of the Water Drawing festival, "Omizutori"? Omizutori is an annual Buddhist festival held every March at Todaiji Temple in Nara, which dates back over 1250 years. It started in 752 when Todaiji Temple (famous for the giant Buddha Statue, "Daibutsu") was built during the Nara period. During the festival, priests confess people's sins before the eleven-faced Kannon Bodhisattva (the goddess of mercy), and pray for the productiveness of grain and for world peace as well. Omizutori was originally held during February in the old calendar. That's why the hall where rituals take place is called "Nigatsu-do" Hall ("Nigatsu" means February). The festival lasts 2 weeks and during the period young ascetics run the corridor of Nigatsu-do, holding up big pine torches in order to show priests in service the way to the Kannon Bodhisattva. Those who are showered with the fire sparks or pick up ember from the torches, are believed to be in good health throughout the year. The highlight of Omizutori is performed on the midnight of March 12th when priests draw water from a well down below Nigatsu-do as an offering to the Kannon Bodhisattva. This spring water is also said to have a special power to cure all diseases. Kansai people, especially Nara people await this festival so eagerly, because they believe that spring come as Omizutori is over. There are a lot of old buildings, historic monuments, and Buddha statues in Nara, which is included in the list of Japan's UNESCO World Heritage Sites. In this tour, our guide will show you the sights to be seen in Todaiji Temple and tell you the history of Omizutori. The price includes a ticket for Todaiji Museum, which offers you an opportunity to see national treasures in the Nara period. On top of that, feeding deer in Nara Park (Todaiji is located in the park) is worth trying! Come and enjoy Omizutori for your happiness and good luck in the coming year! You can see the festival every night from March 1 to March 14, but the highlight is on March 12 when all torches are lit.
strTitle: Watch Buddhist rituals of fire & water, Omizutori in Nara!

strIntroduction: This is a tour of Tokyo's charming old neighbourhood Asakusa with Wagyu beef dinner included and a special present for you - a Japanese kimono! Below is the schedule of this tour: 14:30 - Meeting at Kuramae Station 15:30 - Wear the kimono and walk to Asakusa along the Sumida Riverside, while enjoying the sight of Tokyo Sky Tree. 16:00 - Photo shoot at Kaminarimon gate and visit to the city's oldest Sensoji Temple. Kaminarimon gate is the famous landmark of Asakusa. It was formerly named “Furaijinmon” after the God of Wind, but later on its name was changed to “Kaminarimon”. Enjoy the walk to Nakamise Shopping Street (the road to Sensoji Temple) using all your senses: gaze at the beautiful colors of the souvenir stalls, smell the wonderful fragrances of fresh pastries (and of course, eat them!), touch the silky textures of handcrafted souvenirs and hear the warm and friendly voices of the shop owners! Each store sells many unique stuffs such as Japanese traditional sweets and souvenirs. The smell of rice crackers or deep fried steamed buns will make you hungry so be careful not to overeat there! Many options are available for buying pretty folding fans or souvenirs that would match your kimono. At the end of the Nakamise Street you’ll see Sensoji, the oldest temple in Tokyo, affectionately called by the locals “Asakusa no Kannon-Sama” because of the sacred image of the deity Kannon enshrined in it. This image is believed to be found in the Sumida River in the 36th year of the Asuka Period (628). If you are lucky, you might be able to witness a Japanese style traditional wedding on the way. But our tour won’t be over with the visit to Sensoji Temple! We’re sure you’ll love the other attractions and the delicious snacks available nearby! 18:00 - Enjoy the gourmet teppanyaki grill of a well-known local restaurant! "Tosa Beef" is used as main dish, which is extremely tasty and more rare to find than Kobe beef in Japan. This Japanese beef is not served at other restaurants and it is known as perfectly balanced red meat, not only healthy but also delicious. The chief will cook on a huge iron plate (teppan) in front of the customers - this performance is definitely another must-see event during the meal. Experience a dinner consisting of 8 dishes while enjoying the sight of Tokyo Sky Tree and the old town Asakusa! At the end of this tour (around 20:30) you can take the kimono and obi belt you wore the entire day with you as a gift! This tour is available every day except on Sundays.
strTitle: Tour Asakusa with kimono and eat delicious teppanyaki dinner

strIntroduction: Kyoto prefecture extends north of Kyoto city and reaches the Sea of Japan. In this tour you will be able to visit some secret places in the countryside that only local people know! Pick up and drop off service at your hotel and meals are included! Below is the itinerary of the tour: 8:30 - Pick up from your hotel in Kyoto, Osaka or Kobe area. 10:30 - Visit the biggest swing in the world, registered by the Guinness Book of World Records 12:00 - Visit the Train Cafe for lunch. It used to be a real train a long time ago. ※It's closed on every Wednesday. In such cases we will visit another restaurant. 14:00 - Visit Amanohashidate sandbar. Amanohashidate is widely considered as one of the three most scenic spots in Japan. 16:00 - Visit Kanabiki Waterfall, one of Japan's top 100 waterfalls. 17:30 - Visit the Onidakeinari Shrine in the Oe mountain. 19:00 - Dinner at a Japanese-style house. 21:30 - I will take you back to your hotel. This is a private tour for a maximum of 6 people.
strTitle: Take a day trip to the wonderful rural area of Kyoto

strIntroduction: Tateishi is located in the east part of Tokyo, just 4 stations away from Tokyo Sky Tree. There are a lot of old buildings and little streets that survived the World War II. Small shops stand side by side along the streets. It might feel hard to enter some of the shops at first glance. Most of customers are regular, but once you exchange smiles with them, they will understand you and accept as a member of Tateishi's bar-hopping community. Sometimes they are a bit meddlesome in their kindness attempts, but that's the charm of communicating with local people. Here you can experience the old Tokyo atmosphere that you cannot find at developed tourist spots. Tateishi is traditionally called "Senbero", which means that you can feel good by paying only 1000 JPY. Nowadays, 1000 JPY is not enough actually, but you will enjoy great local foods at a cheap price. There are various types of foods in Tateishi such as sushi, oden (hot pot), horumon (offal meal), ramen noodles, soba noodles and even Italian cuisine.
