My tour starts around early evening and introduces Tateishi on foot. After a bit of a walk we will jump into one of the bars! Enjoy bar-hopping with locals! This tour is available on weekends mainly.
strTitle: Go bar-hopping in the old neighbourhood Tateishi in Tokyo

strIntroduction: Do you know shochu? Shochu is a Japanese distilled liquor, mostly made in Kyushu area. If you come to Kyushu and love drinking, you should definitely try drinking not only Japanese sake but also shochu! In this activity you can drink with locals at a newly opened stylish shochu bar in Kumamoto. The owner of the bar is very friendly and can explain everything about each type of shochu in fluent English! I'll pick you up at "Kumamoto City Hall" tram station (Kumamoto City Hall side) around 21:30 and we will go to the bar directly (less than 5 minutes walk). Since the number of people who can get in to the bar is limited, we envisage having about 3-5 locals and up to 5-7 foreign travelers. We promise you will enjoy Kumamoto's nightlife! * People who do not lilke shochu can order Japanese sake, beer, and soft drinks as well.
strTitle: Have fun and drink with locals at a bar in Kumamoto!

strIntroduction: Zao Onsen Ski Resort in Yamagata prefecture is one of the most popular skiing & snowboarding resorts in Japan. There are 15 different slopes and 12 courses in a broad area so that any level of riders from beginners to experts, kids to seniors, can enjoy skiing or snowboarding. Zao Onsen is a place of wonders. Extremely cold weather in this mountainous area produces not only good powder snow conditions but also beautiful snow monsters ("juhyo" in Japanese), which are like art objects made of ice but are in fact snow-covered pine trees. The fantastic scenery of these snow objects is what sets Zao Onsen apart from other ski resorts. The snow monsters are brightly lit by the night illumination during the peak ski season. Another reason why Zao Onsen attracts so many winter sports lovers is what the name says, its hot springs! The sulfurous hot spring in Zao is said to be discovered about 1900 years ago and works well on wounds, burn injuries, skin diseases, women's diseases, nerve pain, arterial sclerosis, diabetes, and so forth. Imagine soaking in a hot spring after sliding down a snowy ramp - this is the ultimate luxury you cannot miss during your stay in winter! We offer Zao Onsen overnight stay tour from Tokyo. Staying at a casual hotel or ryokan, enjoying skiing or snowboarding among the snow monsters, and refreshing body and soul in a local onsen will surely become a special way to spend your holidays. Of course, each accommodation has hot spring baths, however there are also public baths and foot baths in Zao Onsen village. Take this occasion to try various hot springs and enjoy the winter wonders of Japan! Note: Book the holiday season option for a stay between December 28 and January 3, plus January 9 and 10.
strTitle: Enjoy skiing, snowboarding, and the snow monsters of Zao!

strIntroduction: Gods and Buddha teach us to devote ourselves to others and receive divine quality from them. For example, by donating offertory in the form of money or respect one can hope their visit and prayers will be fruitful. As a result, the gods will bless visitors with divine skills to materialize their wishes. In this tour we will visit several selected Kyoto shrines and temples that bring luck to visitors. The tour will focus on less known shrines where you can pray for divine gifts and hope for improving your fortune. Below are the details of the places we will see during the tour: 1. Ebisu Shrine Along with Nishinomiya Shrine and Osaka Imamiya this shrine is referred to as Japan's one of the three largest Ebisu shrines. This shrine is popular also under the name of "Ebessan". A lot of people from all over Japan to pay visit to Ebessan to pray for business prosperity, family fortunes and traffic safety, especially during the festival held around January 10. Fukumusume and Miko divine girls perform dances of dedication, and visitors are bestowed with a decorated bamboo for good luck . There are also deposits to return old wallet and business card folders that you don't use anymore. 2. Rokuharamitsu Temple This temple was built around the mid-Heian period (AC 900 - 1060) by the monk Kuya Shonin. At the time plague was spreading in Kyoto and Kuya Shonin saved many lives by walking with an 11 faced Buddha statue and chanting the Buddha sutras. The divine deity of Benzaiten (Sarasvati), which is enshrined in Gomado, has been said to provide fortune and luck for games and fights. If you worry over money, visit Rokuharamitsu Temple and pray to "Zeniarai Benzaiten (money washing Sarasvati)", then wash your money using "Jinzui (Holy water)". It’s said that your fortune will improve. 3. Fushimi Inari Shrine It is a shrine to the god of business prosperity and therefore bumper crops are enshrined. Fushimi Inari is the most famous shrine of rising fortune and many companies in Japan come here to pray for prosperous business. In addition, the Inari god is also the god of food and he provides money to buy food. 4. Mikane shrine Mikane shrine is just about money. This fact makes it very unique. Kanayama Hikonomikoto, the God of metals, is the main God of this shrine. Gold, silver and copper which are in currency are enshrined here and many people pay a visit to wish for prosperous business, fortunate asset management such as securities and real estate, victory in gambling and lottery prizes. Here is the schedule of this tour: Meeting place: Kawaramachi intersection Shijo → 12 -minute walk (700 m) → Ebisu Shrine (20 minutes stay) → 10 -minute walk (500 m) → Rokuharamitsu-ji (30 minutes stay) → walk 12 minutes (700 m) → Keihan Shimizu Gojo Station → train 15 minutes → Fushimi Inari Station → 10-minute walk (500 m) → Fushimi- Inari Taisha (50 minutes stay) → 10 -minute walk (500 m) → Fushimi Inari Station → subway Tozai Line transfer 45 minutes → Nijo Castle Station → 5-minute walk → Mikane Shrine (20 minutes stay) → end of tour The entire tour takes about 4 hours.
strTitle: Improve your luck for money with a Kyoto money shrine tour

strIntroduction: We will start the tour at Tamachi Station which is easily reachable by JR line trains. We will walk from there to the Rainbow bridge through the highly industrialized area on Tokyo's harbor. Once we reach the bridge we will be walking the bridge all the way to Odaiba and enjoying the beautiful sights of the city as seen from the bridge. I will be showing you perfect photo spots and show you how to take wonderful photos as well as take photos of you in that location. Once we reach the Odaiba side we will walk near the beach to the Decks area and from there will we take photos of the harbor and the Rainbow bridge as seen from the beach. Near the beach is the replica of the statue of Liberty which is a popular tourist spot for taking photos and a few meters away sits the majestic and futuristic Fuji Television building. We will be taking photos of both these landmarks as and I will show you great places for enjoying the best views. After those experiences, we will walk to the Diver City shopping mall and take photos of the famous Gundam statue located there and then walk to the Venus fort shopping mall which is the home of an Italian looking indoor shopping and restaurant area as well as housing a Ferris wheel nearby. Toyota also has a vehicle showcase in the mall where we may go and look at the cars if you are interested in them. Once finished with the views there, we will take another walk over a bridge and to the business side of Odaiba which is also home to the amazing looking Tokyo Big Sight convention building that hosts many annual shows and looks like something taken out of a sci-fi movie. From there you have the opportunity of taking the Yurikamome monorail line which will take you to Shimbashi Station with access to JR train lines or subway lines in Tokyo. This tour will take approximately 4 hours from the meeting point of Tamachi Station to the end point near Tokyo Big Sight building. There are many convenience stores along the way where we can stop to get snacks or drinks. I will be teaching you about photography and answering your questions about how to get the best photos from each location. I will also be taking photos of yourself so that you can have a splendid memory of this fantastic journey. On the way back you have also the option to take the Rinkai line from Tokyo Teleport Station that is near Venus Fort mall. Every Saturday in December you will have the unique chance to see the sunset over Rainbow Bridge and the short fireworks that light up Tokyo Bay once it gets dark. You can choose between booking: - a tour for a family or a small group - a tour for a couple (with special photos taken of you) - a private tour for solo travelers.
strTitle: Walk Tokyo's famous Rainbow Bridge for an Odaiba Photo Tour!

strIntroduction: Japan is widely known for its pioneering technologies and scientific achievements. Among them are various discoveries and researches in the field of the medicine and biotechnology. Japan contributes regularly to the development of medical care on an international level. Every year prominent Japanese researchers are awarded Nobel prizes for discoveries in chemistry, biology and medicine. It is not surprising then that the country is also high on the list of destinations for medical tourism. Apart from its many natural hot springs that have powerful healing effects, Japan also has multiple top-ranking medical facilities. This package offers a complete and thorough medical check-up in one of Tokyo's best clinics located in Shinjuku. You will be able to choose between one-day and two-day medical check-up which includes the following components: - health survey - general examination by the doctor - body measurements - eyesight examination - hearing test - examination of the intestines - urine analysis - full blood test - cardiovascular examination - examination of the respiratory system - ultrasound examination - gastrointestinal examination In addition to the above, the two-day examination will include also: - osteoporosis examination (for men and women) - lung cancer examination (for men only) - breast cancer examination (for women only) The clinic offers multilingual support in English and Chinese (China and Taiwan). Book this package now to get the best healthcare in Japan! Note: Accommodation is not included.
strTitle: Get a complete medical check-up in a top clinic in Tokyo

strIntroduction: Ama is a Japanese female diver who goes undersea to collect abalone, spiny lobster and other seafood by bare hands. A large number of Ama divers live Toba city, Mie prefecture in Central Japan. Inside Toba city most of them live in the small seaside village Osatsu. Osatsu is an area that has been playing an important role for offering fresh seafood to the Ise Jingu shrines for over 2000 years. The Osatsu village is characterized by its distinctive life based on fishery and high worship for a sea goddess named "Ishigami". Kamado (an Ama hut) is a place where Ama divers make a fire to warm up their body and take a break during the day. In the Kamado hut Ama divers sit around the fire, talk about today’s fishing, husbands, children or friends openly while baking caught shellfish and Japanese rice-cakes or eat snacks. This is a scene that you must see! The Ama hut Kamado in Osatsu provide a place where tourists will be able to eat delicious fresh seafood and experience fun moments with the Ama divers. You may ask questions to the Ama divers such as "what fish can you catch?", "in which season do you dive?", "why are you dressed in white clothes when diving?", "how old is oldest Ama?" and others while eating fresh seafood that will be baked on a charcoal grill. This is an excellent opportunity to learn more about the original Ama divers' culture in Japan! In this activity you will go directly to the Ama hut Kamado in Osatsu for lunch and fun time with the Ama divers. Take the Kuzaki line of the Kamome Bus from JR/Kintetsu Toba Station and exit at the Osatsu Bus Stop (相差バス停) after about 35 minutes ride. From there, walk about 7 minutes to the south until you reach the hut. Please refer to Ama hut Osatsu HP as below: http://www.toba.or.jp/amagoya/top.html
strTitle: Visit a genuine hut of Japanese female divers "ama" in Mie

strIntroduction: Located 200 km northwest of Tokyo in Gunma prefecture, Kusatsu Onsen is a popular hot spring town which boasts the largest volume of hot spring water in the whole of Japan. For ten years running, the town has taken the the number one place on the list of the 100 Best Hot Springs, as ranked by Japan's top travel agents. From the Edo period onwards, Japanese people travelled here from all over the country to take a hot spring cure, because Kusatsu's hot springs were believed to heal all kinds of illnesses and diseases (with the exception of lovesickness). During the Tokugawa era, one of the shoguns actually ordered his men to transport spring water all the way from Kusatsu to his residence, Edo Castle. Even today, Kusatsu Onsen still retains its historic ambiance and its traditions, as well as its wonderful sense of hospitality. We offer overnight stays in Kusatsu Onsen for travellers setting out from Tokyo who want to stay at a traditional Japanese inn, a "ryokan", and to refresh body and soul by soaking in a hot spring. As you stroll beside the "yubatake" (hot spring field) in your yukata, or sleep on tatami mats, you will definitely feel like you are in Japan! At breakfast and dinner, you will be served regional delicacies and locally grown vegetables. In Kusatsu, there are all kinds of ways for you to rest and to relax. A variety of options and facilities are available, depending on your budget. For couples, a room with a private rotenburo (open-air bath) is highly recommended. See the details below. You can choose from: a standard Japanese-style room (futon only), a luxury Japanese-style room or a luxury Japanese-style room with a private open-air bath (rotenburo). You can also add a transportation between Tokyo and Kusatsu Onsen as an option. This tour does not include a guide.
strTitle: Visit Kusatsu and take a relaxing dip in the hot springs!

strIntroduction: Yamashiro Onsen is one of the biggest onsen towns on the west coast of Japan. It's a town that boasts many old buildings in the traditional style. The architecture is truly impressive. It's a beautiful place and you are going to love wandering around it. Yamashiro Onsen is only an hour away from Kanazawa, so some people just travel here to have a quick look at the town. But you really should come and stay the night here, so you can enjoy Yamashiro Onsen to your heart's content. The highlight is the hot springs (onsen)! The hot springs have a history dating back 1300 years. They are loved by local people and have also proved popular with famous writers and artists, many of whom have visited this place. The baths use water that flows from Yamashiro Onsen's oldest spring (incidentally, the water from the spring is drinkable). People say that the water helps to keep your skin smooth, as well as reducing your sensitivity to the cold. Whichever ryokan you decide to stay in, you will be able to bathe in the hot springs. There is even a rotenburo, an open-air hot spring, located outside the bathhouse building. The contrast between the hot water and the cool air is incredibly refreshing! Some ryokan inns have a private hot spring of their own for a rare and valuable experience. When you go out, you can enjoy strolling around the town and visiting some of the beautiful old buildings. One place you should certainly visit is "Haduchi-wo-Rakudo". Here you can enjoy local cuisine, admire the traditional arts and crafts, do some shopping, and relax while drinking a cup of green tea. Haduchi-wo-Rakudo is also a popular place for locals to meet up. Enjoying the same things the locals do will definitely make your stay more interesting! Choose between overnight stay in luxurious regular Japanese-style room, luxurious room with a private hot spring pool, or a regular room. *All the options include round trip Shinkansen tickets fare from Tokyo to Kanazawa and JR tickets from Kanazawa to Kaga Onsen Station. *There will be a free pick up service from Kaga Onsen Station.
strTitle: Stay at Yamashiro Onsen and enjoy the wonderful hot spring!

strIntroduction: In this tour we will walk around Tokyo Tower in the early morning, around 8:00 am, and learn more about the history of Japan by visiting several important historical locations that are less-known among foreign visitors. Do you know there are many historical and cultural places around the iconic Tokyo Tower? In this tour I'll show you three notable places of interest: 1. Zojoji Temple: the temple relevant to the Tokugawa Shogunate, and one of the biggest and best Buddhist temples in Tokyo. 2. Shiba public park: I can take a fantastic photo for you at this pleasant city park. I'm sure this is the best place to take a shot of you together with Tokyo Tower. 3. Shiba Toshogu: the shrine that worships the famous shogun Tokugawa Ieyasu. He is known as the first person who ruled Japan during the long Edo period (17-19th century). The early bird catches the worm! Let's get up early and enjoy Tokyo in the brisk morning! Be an early bird and come with me on this tour!
strTitle: Take a Morning Walking Tour near Tokyo Tower for Early Birds

strIntroduction: The Mito City is celebrating its 121st annual Mito Plum Festival in 2017. The festival owes its origins to the Ueno – Mito rail line which was completed in 1896 and brought people from Tokyo to the first Mito no Ume Matsuri. For Japanese people, plum blossom is a special flower that tells people that spring is just around the corner. There are two festival sites: Kairakuen Park and Kodokan Hall Park. Kairakuen Park boasts around 3,000 trees of 100 types of plums, and Kodokan Hall Park about 800 trees of 60 types of plums that will all be in bloom throughout the festival. Kairakuen Park is more famous, known as one of the three great gardens in Japan. It suffered damage from the March 2011 earthquake, but was repaired and fully reopened in February 2012. The entire garden is filled with the fragrance of plum blossoms and colored in gradations of light pink and is simply fantastical. Perfume of the scent of plum blossoms is also sold at the shop in the garden. You can also enjoy illuminations at night time for about 2 weeks during the festival period. Viewing plum blossoms is not the only fun to be had. Various events will take place nearly every Saturday and Sunday inside Kairakuen Park. Some events include tea ceremonies, Japanese drum performances, and much more. The Mito Plum Festival 2017 is held from February 18 through March 31. Kairakuen Park is open from 6:00 to 19:00 during the festival period, and until 21:00 during the illumination period from March 6 to 22. Kodokan Hall Park is open from 9:00 to 17:00 during the festival period. A special temporary railway station opens next to the Kairakuen Park during the festival (the exact dates are to be confirmed). However, you can also decide to go directly to Mito Station and visit also the Kodokan Hall Park. Seats for the train ride are often fully booked so use our service and secure seats to see the amazing plum fiesta in Mito!
strTitle: Be amazed at the beautiful blossoms of Mito Plum Festival!

strIntroduction: The Tokamachi Snow Festival was started in 1950 by the citizens and for the citizens of Tokamachi based on the motto “let’s not make snow our enemy, let’s make snow our friend” in this heavy snowfall area. Snow often piles up to 2 or higher meters in the city of Tokamachi, located in the mountainous interior of Niigata prefecture. It calls itself the first ever snow festival celebrated in Japan, even though the Sapporo Snow Festival started in the same year. Compared to the Sapporo Snow Festival, the Tokamachi Snow Festival has a less commercial and more attractive neighborhood atmosphere. There are about two dozen festival sites (hiroba) of varying sizes, some of which are located within the city center while others are further away from town. The largest among them is the Community Hiroba, about ten minutes on foot from Tokamachi Station. The site features multiple snow sculptures, snow-related activities and rides, and a large selection of festival food stalls. Near the Tokamachi Elementary School, the "Snow Carnival" show is held on the evening of the Saturday on a large stage made of snow. The show is one of the highlights of the festival, featuring appearances by popular artists, light displays, songs, dance and pyrotechnics. Admission is free, and the show lasts about 90 minutes. The fireworks decorating the sky at the finale of the Snow Carnival make snowy scenery that appears straight out of a fantasy world! In this tour you will secure a local hotel accommodation in Tokamachi town or Echigo area plus transportation from Tokyo. The package includes one-way train ride and one night accommodation. You can decide to extend your stay or book the return train as an add-on option. The Tokamachi Snow Festival 2017 is held from February 17 through February 19. The festival starts at 6 p.m. on Friday, and ends around 4 p.m. on Sunday.
strTitle: Make snow your friend at the Tokamachi Snow Festival!

strIntroduction: The Otaru Snow Light Path was started in 1999. This event now enjoys more than 500,000 visitors every year in February. The city becomes decorated in candle lights and small snow statues for ten days. The event remains as it has been as long as there is the light shines in people's hearts, even though times change. It usually runs at the same time as the nearby Sapporo Snow Festival, making it possible for travelers in Hokkaido to visit both festivals on the same trip. The Otaru festival takes approximately 35 minutes from Sapporo to Otaru by JR. There are various kinds of ice candles made by citizens of the city that can be seen along the canal and shopping streets, all within walking distance from the JR train station. There are two main official areas: the Canal (Unga) site and Former Temiya Railway Line (Temiyasen) site. Floating on the freezing surface of the Otaru Canal is the wavering light of candles in the glass floats made of the same product once used for herring fishing. The service of the Tamiya line was terminated finishing its role in 1985, but the track remains as a precious relic of railway. The dead track having a snow tunnel, and rimmed with thousands of candles seems to stretch endlessly. And here is another extra site for you: the Asarigawa Hot Spring Village (Asarigawa Onsen) site. In this site, now well-known not only for its wonderful hot springs but also as a place for skiing and snowboarding, you can enjoy the fantastic scene of the light of candles placed on the snow-covered stones in the river. Furthermore, a total of more than 100,000 private candles illuminate many other places of the city during the festival period. The Otaru Snow Light Path festival creates a unique romantic atmosphere that you would love to experience with the person close to your heart and soul! In this tour you will secure a hotel accommodation in nearby Sapporo during the Snow Festival (when many hotels are often fully booked up), eat fresh sushi at a good-quality local restaurant, and see the highlights of the festival and Otaru city during a half-day tour. You can choose between the following options: - Otaru Festival premium tour: includes one night at a hotel in Sapporo, lunch or dinner at a sushi restaurant, and a half-day guided tour. - Otaru Festival value tour: includes one night at a private apartment in Sapporo, lunch or dinner at a sushi restaurant, and a half-day guided tour. - Otaru Festival budget tour: includes one night at a private apartment in Sapporo and lunch or dinner at a sushi restaurant. Important: Sapporo accommodation will be used. The train ride between Sapporo and Otaru (about 40 minutes, regular trains) is not included in the price. The Otaru Snow Light Path 2016 is held from February 5 through February 14. The sites get lit up daily from 17:00 to 21:00.
strTitle: The Otaru Snow Light Path Festival from Sapporo, Hokkaido!

strIntroduction: The Sapporo Snow Festival was started in 1950, when high school students built a few snow statues in the centrally located Odori Park. It has since developed into a large, commercialized event, featuring spectacular snow and ice sculptures and attracting more than two million visitors from Japan and across the world. The Snow Festival is staged on three sites: the Odori site, Susukino site and Community Dome “Tsudome” site. Located in central Sapporo, Odori Park stretches a mile long and is the main site of the festival. Most of the event’s sculptures are exhibited here, including the largest ones. Odori Park also offers musical concerts and other events. A good view over the Odori Site can be enjoyed from the Sapporo TV Tower at the eastern end of Odori Park. The tower has extended hours (8:30 to 22:30) during the festival. The Susukino site has the second highest number of sculptures at the festival (particularly focusing on ice art) and is illuminated until midnight. Susukino is also Sapporo’s biggest entertainment section and is a great place to go for a night out on the town after enjoying the day’s festivities. Susukino is located only one subway stop south of Odori Park. The less centrally located Tsudome site is a family oriented snow playground with three types of snow slides, snow rafting and more snow sculptures. Tsudome’s regional cuisine and ice bar make sure it is friendly for both adults and children. In this tour you will secure a hotel accommodation in Sapporo during the Snow Festival (when many hotels are often fully booked up), eat the local specialty - crab dinner - at a top-quality restaurant, and see the highlights of the festival and Sapporo city during a half-day tour. You can choose between the following options: - Snow Festival premium tour: includes one night at a hotel in Sapporo, dinner at a restaurant specializing in crab cuisine, and a half-day guided tour. - Snow Festival value tour: includes one night at a private apartment or in a hotel in Sapporo, dinner at a restaurant specializing in crab cuisine, and a half-day guided tour. - Snow Festival budget tour: includes one night at a private apartment or in a hotel in Sapporo and a dinner at a restaurant specializing in crab cuisine. All bookings must be made for a minimum of 2 people. Here is the schedule of the Sapporo Snow Festival 2016: Held from February 6 through February 12 at Odori site/Susukino site and Tsudome site. Odori site: Lit up daily until 22:00 Susukino site: Lit up daily until 23:00 (until 22:00 on the festival's final day) Tsudome site: Open daily from 9:00 to 17:00
strTitle: Enjoy the winter fantasy of the Sapporo Snow Festival!

strIntroduction: As a fashion coordinator, I can help you if you are interested in visiting little known old-clothes stores which are gaining popularity in Tokyo quickly. Let's meet at Harajuku, the Mecca of Japan's fashion and start our adventure! Tell me about your preferred fashion style and I'll introduce you to some of the best places. We will go to many old clothes stores, and some new ones too. Some of the stores have a truly crazy fashion, some offer fashion from the 70s and 80s... You will be impressed by the variety! Join this fashion tour with me and find little known great places in Tokyo!
strTitle: 40% OFF Tour many fashionable old-clothes stores in Tokyo

strIntroduction: This is an exclusive plan for an unforgettable and complete relaxation at one of Japan's best hot spring resorts Hakone, not far from Mt Fuji. Enjoy your stay or book this tour as a precious present for the ones you love! Choose your preferred booking plan from the drop-down menu: - accommodation with hot springs - accommodation with head spa - accommodation with beauty hair care - accommodation with beauty spa care Below is the example itinerary of this tour package: Day 1 - Meeting Location: Hakone Yumoto Station at 3:00 pm. Go directly to the cottage. - Enjoy free time or Beauty & Spa in our top-class facility -We will take you hot spring place and restaurant! Day 2 - Check out of the cottage in the morning by 10:00 am. - Drive you to station! After check out..You can enjoy by yourself ex) Hakone sightseeing by private car or take train for a few hours. (Hakone shrines, Lake Ashi, the pirate ship and some other historical places. ) What is the cottage equipped with? - Clean towels, tooth brushes, hair dryer, hair brush, kitchen and dinning facilities for self-catering, cotton swab, Wi-Fi, TV, air-conditioner, room heating system are all included. This tour is available on weekdays only.
strTitle: Relax in an exclusive beauty resort in Hakone!

strIntroduction: We will explore Kyoto's most popular area Gion and Kiyomizu together on foot. We will visit Gion's old streets (including unknown but nice places), Kiyomizudera Temple (a UNESCO World Heritage), local shops (free sweets tasting), Ninenzaka hill, Ghibli shop, Maruyama Park, Yasaka Shrine and Kamo River! The following is the example of time schedule. Morning tour: 8:45 Meet at Kawaramachi station (terminal station of Hankyu Kyoto Line) on Shijo St. 9:00-9:10 Enjoy the river view of Kamo River 9:10-10:10 Explore Gion's old streets (including Hanamikoji-dori St. and Ishibekoji St.) on the way to Kiyomizudera Temple 10:10-11:00 Visit and explore Kiyomizudera Temple (one of the most celebrated temples of Japan) 11:00-12:00 Enjoy shopping in Kiyomizu-Zaka St. and Ninenzaka St.(see many Kyoto's local sweets shops, souvenir shops and Ghibli shops) on the way to Maruyama Park. 12:00-13:00 Visit Maruyama Park (famous for cherry blossom and Japanese garden) and Yasaka Shrine (one of the most famous shrines). 13:15 (or 13:45) Finish the tour at Yasaka Shrine or Kawaramachi station. (13:15, We might eat lunch together if we have free time after the tour) Afternoon tour: 13:45 Meet at Kawaramachi station (terminal station of Hankyu Kyoto Line) on Shijo St. 14:00-14:10 Enjoy the river view of Kamo River 14:10-15:10 Explore Gion's old streets (including Hanamikoji-dori St. and Ishibekoji St.) on the way to Kiyomizudera Temple 15:10-16:00 Visit and explore Kiyomizudera Temple (one of the most celebrated temples of Japan) 16:00-17:00 Enjoy shopping in Kiyomizu-Zaka St. and Ninenzaka St. (many Kyoto's local sweets shops, souvenir shops and Ghibli shops) on the way to Maruyama Park. 17:00-18:00 Visit Maruyama Park (famous for cherry blossom and Japanese garden) and Yasaka Shrine (one of the most famous shrines). 18:15 Finish the tour at Yasaka Shrine or Kawaramachi station. (18:15, We might eat dinner together if we have free time after the tour) We can start the tour earlier if you wish (8:30 am). Enjoy Kyoto together with a local person!
strTitle: Take a half-day walking tour around Gion and Kiyomizu, Kyoto

strIntroduction: This is the perfect activity for newly-wed couples or lovers who wish to experience traditional Japanese ways of marriage and an unforgettable photo session followed by delicious kaiseki-style (multi-dish) meal! Enjoy an elegant photo session dressed in wedding kimono and then go to a traditional-style restaurant to eat a gorgeous dinner prepared for special occasions! As an additional option, you can experience a real Shinto-style wedding ceremony performed by a Shinto priest! Below is the schedule of the main activity option: 3:00 pm Meet at the photo studio 3:15 pm Prepare for wedding kimono wearing 4:15 pm Photo session with a professional photographer 5:15 pm Select your pictures 5:45 pm Move to the traditional restaurant 6:00 pm Dinner - kaiseki cuisine This is a private program offered in English that will be arranged upon your request. Please note that there will be no guide. This activity is held in Kisarazu city, Chiba prefecture (about an hour and a half away by train from Tokyo).
strTitle: Experience Japanese Shinto-style wedding and Kaiseki dinner

strIntroduction: Tetsudou Izakaya Little TGV in Akihabara, Tokyo, is a restaurant where you can experience the realistic atmosphere of the interior of the railways in Japan. The definition of “Tetsudou” in Japanese is “Railway”. Little TGV is located in Akihabara which is known as a major shopping center for household electronic goods. It is also popular as an otaku cultural center so you will be able to see the unusual unique side of Japan. When you enter Little TGV, the cute train crews from New Akiba Electric Railway will welcome you and serve you dishes. Inside the restaurant, you can freely examine many kinds of model railroads. Also, some of the seats are taken from the real railways so you can experience and feel like you’re having dinner in a real train. The menu is printed on a train route map and from this point we’re sure that you can already feel the uniqueness of Little TGV. You may enjoy with the appearance of a lot of kinds of dishes, such as SL chips, Shinkansen rice balls, rattling fried potatoes and 3-car-train rolled omelette. The three main cocktail menus are “TGV original special cocktails”, “Train cocktails” and “Shinkansen cocktails”, including non-alcohol cocktails. Most of the names of dishes are taken from the real names of existing railways and Shinkansen lines in Japan, so it is very exciting to try cocktails from your favorite train. Little TGV is a restaurant where not only train lovers but also family and couples and can enjoy. Experience the unique culture of Japan through our reservation system! Tetsudou Izakaya Little TGV is open every day under the following schedule: Lunch (Saturdays, Sundays and national holidays only): 12:00 – 17:00 Dinner (Monday – Friday): 18:00 – 23:00 (22:00 last order) Dinner (Saturdays, Sundays and national holidays): 17:00 – 23:00 (22:00 last order) Average cost of a lunch per person: 1,000 – 2,000 JPY Average cost of a dinner per person: 2,000 – 3,000 JPY ※This is the reservation service only. You will need to pay for drinks and meals at the cafe.
strTitle: Reservation for Tetsudou Izakaya Little TGV Akihabara, Tokyo

strIntroduction: Christon Cafe in Shinjuku, Tokyo, is a unique restaurant in the centre of Tokyo. It recreates the atmosphere of a church in the old days of medieval Europe. It's special decor makes it more and more popular, especially since 2013 when it featured in the Japanese TV program, called “Sunday without God." Once you step into the restaurant, you'll understand why this place is unique. The predominant color of Christon Cafe is white and there are several altars and antique furniture, imported from overseas. You can enjoy your dinner on a wide sofa, sitting at a marble table gorgeous chandeliers overhead. The dinner in Christon Cafe is based on Italian and French cuisine, but you can also select dishes from other European countries. Names on the menu refer to the bible. There are dishes like salmon & cheese spring roll with Genovese sauce, assorted hams including Iberico and Serrano, Hungarian foie gras risotto and pastas with big whole prawn tomato cream sauce or quattro formaggi and honey sauce. The signature cocktails in this restaurant both elegant and fascinating. Some are named “Angel’s Trap”, “Dark Raider”, “Fujiyama” and “Death scythe of Hell”. Tempted already?! Try them when you visit Christon Cafe. Guests love the bizarre atmosphere and the beautifully decorated dishes. Having your reservation in advance is the way to go, or you will be queuing outside for a long time. Use our reservation system to experience this unique Tokyo restaurant. Christon Cafe is open every day: Dinner only: 5 pm to 11 pm (last order at 10.30 pm) Average cost of a dinner per person: 3,000 – 4,000 JPY Credit cards might not be accepted, so please bring sufficient cash. ※This is the reservation service only. You will need to pay for drinks and meals at the cafe.
strTitle: Reservation for Medieval Europe Christon Cafe Shinjuku,Tokyo

strIntroduction: Yurei Izakaya in Kichijoji, Tokyo, is a unique restaurant where you can enjoy the atmosphere of a Japanese style haunted house. The word “Yurei” in Japanese literally means “ghost”. You get the sense of Yurei immediately, because of the spooky interiors and the creepy music. In fact, when hearing it from outside, you might not even dare to go in! When you get to the restaurant, you’ll have to cautiously go down the stairs while you hear sutras chanting. When you reach the bottom of the stairs and open the door, you'll enter a spooky, unearthly atmosphere. The “ghost waiters” will welcome amid lot of stupas and it will make you feel like entering the world of the ghosts. If you are lucky, especially on the weekends, you might see a show staged. Comic stories, short stand-up comedy or magic tricks are produced by the “ghosts”. They will tell you some scary stories so that you can’t sleep after the show... In any case, the menu in Yurei is pretty creepy. For example, guests have been served dishes including “Blood Mud of Hell” which is a spicy ox-tail soup, and other dishes with interesting names like “Burning Spare Ribs”, “Straw Figures”, “Intestine of the Ghosts” and “Scary Snow Woman’s Burning Love”. Even the set menus are named ominous, for example “Departed Soul Land menu”, “Funeral menu” and “Menu of Death”. You may also try the exciting Russian roulette game accompanying the Yurei in some dishes! Don’t miss the opportunity to experience this interesting restaurant in Tokyo! Yurei Izakaya is open every day: Dinner: 17:00 – 01:00 (24:30 last order) Average cost of a dinner per person: 3,000 – 4,000 JPY Credit cards might not be accepted, so please bring sufficient cash ※This is the reservation service only. You will need to pay for drinks and meals at the cafe.
strTitle: Reservation for Haunted Yurei Izakaya Kichijoji in Tokyo

strIntroduction: Japan is a land of contrasts. The seemingly brand new asphalted roads that take you everywhere, against the backdrop of bright green rice fields. Glass and steel skyscrapers surrounding century-old Shinto shrines. The contrasting scenery is truly fascinating. But how about watching 9,000 near-naked men do their utmost to get hold of a set of sticks, measuring just 4 cm in diameter and 20 cm in length, thrown into the crowd by the priest from a window 4 m up. Luck means a lot in Japanese life. In Okayama, once a year, the Hadaka Matsuri or festival is held for just that. To ensure that the one man who grasps the lucky sticks faster then all others, and manages to throw them upright into a small wooden box pilled with rice, gets a full year of good luck. A full year! "Wasshoi! Wasshoi!", you will hear as the herd of almost fully naked men nears the festival place. You will feel the crowd growing more and more excited. And you will be there before and after the main event, when Japanese culture is at a peak and some locals are dressed up and ready. Performance of Japanese taiko drums and winter fireworks add up to the exciting schedule of the festival. Preliminary schedule of the festival (February 18, 2017) 15:20: Young school kids competing (the junior version of the festival) 17:40: Japanese traditional dance and music performance 18:30: Japanese taiko drums performance 19:00: Winter fireworks special 22:00: The peak of the Hadaka naked men festival This experience is made available to you in an easy package of convenient transport from Kyoto or Osaka, including one hotel night. No hassle, just enjoy one of the most bizarre Japanese cultural events of the year! Staying overnight is necessary as the most interesting part of the festival begins after 22:00. You will have the chance to book special spectator seats or access to the dedicated paid standing area and see everything in front of your eyes! Below is the description of this tour in brief: - depart from the Kyoto or Osaka railway station - ride the fast bullet train to Okayama and go to straight to Saidaiji Temple. The Shinkansen ride is about 1 hour, but you will change at Okayama Station to JR Ako line for 20 more minutes until the final destination - Saidaiji Station, from where the festival venue is about 15 minutes away on foot. - visit the festival and miss nothing; you have prearranged special seats or dedicated standing space! - stay for the night in central Okayama or near the town (it is recommended to check-in before going to the festival venue). Optional: - return to Kyoto or Osaka by bullet train on the next day. If you wish, you can go to another destination or spend more time in Okayama.
strTitle: Be amazed at the Okayama Hadaka naked men festival! (Feb 18)

strIntroduction: This is one of those chances to feel the real Japan you cannot let slip past you. Whether you opt for the simple yet exciting "hot spring in a Japanese inn-only" program or take the opportunity to add finishing touches like a traditional lunch, dinner or even "an overnight on futon" in your ryokan, you are ensured to get the great Hakone experience! The Hakone region is probably the best known area in Japan for its hot springs and inns. Both Japanese and travelers from all over the globe come here to experience just this; soak in the hot spring, take a relaxing stroll through the perfectly manicured gardens and sit back with friends to sample the wide range of small and delicately prepared dishes. And after that, why not take another stroll under the moonlight, dressed the part? In your yukata (a cotton kimono) and wooden slippers! Your experience can be like that, with the added luxury of coming and going by quick and scenic "Romance car" a special train that connects Hakone and the capital nearly without stops. It has big windows too! There are various options to choose from, fitting your wishes and budget. If you can though, we highly recommend to make the most of this unique trip and add at least a meal and maybe even the overnight stay. Japanese, with their high emphasis on service and privacy, often offer you the possibility to enjoy your hot spring experience in private, in a room of your own. Imagine that! What can you choose: Option 1 is to travel by Romance car from Tokyo and enjoy the hot springs in a traditional ryokan in Hakone. Option 2 has extra to option 1 to stroll through the Japanese garden and enjoy a set lunch experience. Options 3, 4 and 5 have extra to option 2 to rest in a private guest room after your hot spring experience at the inn. Yukata included. And you may choose between lunch or dinner. Options 6, 7 and 8 are equal to option 3, but include both lunch and dinner. Option 9 adds the overnight stay in a typical Japanese room to option 6. Of course breakfast is included as well. Option 10. To option 9 it adds 2 baths: one inside and one in the garden of your room!
strTitle: Day trip to Hakone in a romantic hot spring inn, from Tokyo!

strIntroduction: In this activity, a kimono professional will visit you at a specified place for private dressing. There is no need for you to visit a shop and thus you can save time! This is a completely private and convenient kimono dressing activity. You may take the kimono back home with you. Please tell the expert that you are taking it back. You can also take the obi belt and geta sandals. Alternatively, you can return it back by shipping with no extra charges.
