Available times: every day 9 am - 7 pm Area: Tokyo, Kanagawa, Saitama, Chiba Additional fees will occur for the following areas: Outside of the 23 wards ofn Tokyo: +500 Yen Kanagawa/Chiba/Saitama: +1000 Yen *Please pay in cash for this additional fee.
strTitle: Rent or buy a kimono, wearing help at your hotel

strIntroduction: A cat bar warmly welcomes you in the nightlife district of Ueno. Bar Neko ("neko" means cat), located in a lively and busy place but hidden like a secret house, is run by the female bartender Yumiko Mine and the kitten (Singapura) hostess Akubi. So even if you are a female and alone, you can feel free to enter the room. When you open the door, you will see a kitten hanging around. The Singapura Akubi, which is loved by regular customers, takes kindly to people, walks around the room, frisks about, and may sit on your lap. Why not caressing and massaging her? You may be healed by her very cute sleeping face. Of course, more than 200 drinks are available, so even if you just want to drink, there is no problem. The prices are reasonable. It is OK even if you order just one drink. If you do not know about drinks well, feel free to ask Yumiko Mine. The recommendation is the original cocktail “Neko,” a tequila-based frozen cocktail using lemon sherbet. Yumiko Mine says that it matches the image of a mischievous cat. She also recommends bourbons and cassis cocktails. Enjoy drinking and chatting with her and friendly regular customers. There are only 12 seats but you may feel at home. To have a wonderful time in the bar, you need to make a reservation. You can book your seats through our restaurant reservation service. Bar Neko is open every day except on Sundays and national holidays under the following schedule: Business hours: 19:00 – 2:00 am (depending on the day: you can stay further if you like) Average cost per person: 3,000 JPY
strTitle: Reservation for the cat Bar Neko, Tokyo!

strIntroduction: Hakuba in the Japanese Alps in Nagano prefecture, is one of Japan’s best known ski resorts and a major winter destination for international visitors from all over the world! The area consists of multiple ski slopes for beginners and expert ski enthusiasts: Hakuba Happo-One, Hakuba Iwatake, Hakuba 47 and many more! Many of them were used as venues during the Winter Olympics in Nagano in 1998. Furthermore, this resort is well-known for its hot springs, and you can experience the joy of soaking in an outdoor hot spring while enjoying the snowy landscape around you! Due to the limited hotel availability and the popularity of the Hakuba ski resort, the accommodation for this trip will be decided at a later stage and closer to the date of your trip. Please note that you cannot select the lodge in this tour. All accommodation facilities are within Hakuba resort area. You can choose between simple-lodging and a luxury grade-up lodging. Below is the itinerary for this tour: Day 1 6:40-7:30 – Depart by bus or train from Shinjuku Bus Terminal/Shinjuku Station 11:30-12:30 – Arrive in the Hakuba area, check in at your hotel and receive a lift ticket for one day and a half day of skiing. Enjoy free time skiing and snowboarding in Hakuba! Have a delicious meal for dinner. Day 2 Start the day with a healthy breakfast meal at your lodge before checking out. Enjoy more of the wonderful skiing and snowboarding over Hakuba’s slopes or visit a hot spring during your free time. 15:30 - 16:15 – Depart from Hakuba by bus or train ~22:00 – Arrive at Shinjuku Bus Terminal or Shinjuku Station The tour includes a round-trip bus or train ride, lift tickets for minimum 1 day, and accommodation with dinner and breakfast. You can rent ski equipment at any rental store in the resort. It is okay to take your own ski wear on the bus. Note: Infants and children up to the age of 6 can join this tour for free, as long as they don't occupy a seat in the train/bus and don't occupy a bed in the accommodation. Don't miss this chance to experience skiing and playing in the snow at one of Japan's best ski resorts, Hakuba!
strTitle: Enjoy two days in the ski paradise Hakuba, Japanese Alps

strIntroduction: Kyoto prefecture extends north of Kyoto city and reaches the Sea of Japan. It has a wonderful countryside atmosphere that you can experience in this special 2-day tour! You will visit some of the most famous sightseeing spots in Kyoto prefecture, including Amanohashidate, one of Japan's three best sights. You will be able to soak in an onsen hot spring and sleep in a traditional Japanese-style house! Try this unique rural experience and see how people in the countryside live! Below is the itinerary of the tour: Day 1 13:30 We will meet at JR Fukuchiyama Station. Pick up from your hotel in Kyoto is available for an additional fee. Please see the booking options below. In this case I will pick you up 12:30 from your hotel in the Kyoto area.) 13:00-14:00 Drive around the local area 15:00 Visit Amanohashidate, one of Japan's three best sights 17:00 Visit the Kanabiki Waterfall. 18:30 Dinner at a Japanese-style house 20:00 Visit the Fukuchiyama Onsen hot spring 21:30 Free time Day 2 8:30 Breakfast 10:00 Visit Ichinomiya Shrine 11:00 Visit the Fukuchiyama Castle 12:00 BBQ Japanese style 14:30 I will take you to back to Fukuchiyama Station where the tour ends. This is a private tour for a maximum of 6 people. 1 night accommodation in a Japanese-style house, dinner, breakfast, and a BBQ lunch are all included in the price.
strTitle: Spend two days in the wonderful rural areas of Kyoto

strIntroduction: What is Japanese calligraphy? Calligraphy is a part of the Japanese culture in which black ink and a brush are used to write kanji or hiragana characters on a white sheet. Kanji have a meaning and each written word shows the person’s personality. Even the same word can show his/her personality depending on the location and balance of the white space of the paper and the black color of the ink. It seems to be difficult at first, but it is all about understanding the characteristic of each word and expressing it with your mind freely. The aroma from the ink helps you to concentrate on writing and calms your mind as well. Having a calm mind is an essential part of the Japanese culture. Below is the itinerary of this activity: 1. Meet up in front of Himeji Castle or Himeji Station and walk to the classroom together 2. Start the calligraphy experience! Practice your name in kanji or any words you like 3. Now it’s the time for final writing! Write down anything you want on the final paper that you will take home 4. At the end, relax and enjoy matcha green tea and Japanese sweets 5. End of the Japanese calligraphy experience This activity is available from Monday to Saturday between 10:00am and 4:00pm. It takes about 75 minutes.
strTitle: Enjoy Japanese calligraphy, green tea, and local sweets

strIntroduction: If you want to experience the wonderful pleasure of staying overnight in a traditional Japanese-style inn with a great view and surrounded by nature, then Kajikaso is the right choice for your trip to Hakone and Mt Fuji area! The rooms are designed in an attractive mix of traditional Japanese and modern style, but the highlight is by far the private hot spring pool available on the veranda overlooking the rapid stream of Hayakawa River. On top of that, Kajikaso is easily accessible by train, located only 5 minutes away from Hakone-Yumoto Station on the Odakyu Line (direct access from Shinjuku)! Kajikaso is a large accommodation facility which focuses on all the aspects that create a relaxing and refreshing atmosphere for its guests. The rooms are spacious, with large windows that provide brilliant views of the surrounding mountains or the fresh stream of Hayakawa River. There are a total of 9 hot spring sources on the grounds of Kajikaso, and the hotel boasts a variety of hot spring pools (including several outdoor baths) for your comfort and relaxation. The abundance of natural resources has resulted in installing a private hot spring pool in the rooms as well! You can choose between: - a traditional Japanese-style room (sleeping on a futon on tatami mats) - a mixed Japanese-Western style room (has a space with tatami mats but also twin beds) All rooms are equipped with a bathroom, toilet, and a TV set. The mixed-style room has a round-shape earthenware pool on the balcony with a view to the surrounding mountains. The Japanese-style room boasts a large outdoor veranda pool with an original hot spring source and a commanding view over Hayakawa River flowing just below. Of course, you can also tour the hotel's shared hot springs as well! Breakfast and dinner include a Japanese-style multi-dish cuisine which extracts the best flavours from local vegetables, delicacies, and seafood! Check in is between 3pm and 7:30pm. Check-out is at 10am. The price remains unchanged all year round so don't miss this chance to book a ryokan room at one of Japan's best hideouts near Tokyo!
strTitle: A ryokan room with a private hot spring in Hakone

strIntroduction: Urabandai in the Aizu region, Tohoku (North Japan), is a true natural paradise where you can immerse yourself in beautiful nature and an authentic rural landscape. Shaped by the activity of the extinct volcano Mt Bandai, the Urabandai highland impresses with unspoiled nature in which you will find many ponds with astonishing water colour, a large lake that submerged a whole village, and various trekking paths. The entire area is blessed with hot springs, delicious food, and Japan's best sake. By booking this 2-day private tour you will have the rare chance to discover a real "off-the-beaten-track" destination that does not have a touristic atmosphere and will satisfy your adventurous spirit! In this tour you will stay in a classy hotel in Urabandai highland, close to the impressive presence of Mt Bandai and Lake Hibara. You can spend a wonderful time exploring the natural area on your own or booking the additional tour options to enjoy a variety of outdoor experiences that will make your trip truly remarkable! Below are the itinerary and highlights of this unique tour that you will never forget! Day 1 6:40 - Take the Shinkansen bullet train from Tokyo to Koriyama Station (recommended train: Yamabiko 203) and change to the local train on Banetsu-sai line at 8:31. 9:09 - Arrive at Inawashiro Station where you will be picked up by a hotel bus and transported to Hotel Gran Deco. The rest of the day is free time to explore the natural paradise, but you can book the add-on Optional tours 1 from the list below. Day 2 9:00 - Check out of Hotel Gran Deco and go back to Inawashiro Station from where you can take the local train to Koriyama Station, and from there the Shinkansen bullet train to Tokyo (about 2.5 hours). You can choose to book the add-on Optional tours 2 or 3 from the list below and extend your experience in Aizu area. Transportation from and to Inawashiro Station, accommodation, and meals (1 dinner, 1 breakfast) are included. IMPORTANT: When booking this tour on November 21, November 28 and December 5, as well as on Saturdays in January, February and March, plus January 10 and March 20, you need to pay extra charge. Please book also the add-on option "Extra charge" in addition to the basic tour option. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Add-on Optional tours (you can book them together with the main tour): 1. Trekking in Goshikinuma, Day 1: Explore the forested area of Goshikinuma and see Urabandai's famous colourful ponds (whose water ranges from cobalt blue to red thanks to mineral deposits). You will walk the 3.6-kilometer-long trekking path from Bandai Kogen to Bishamon Pond together with an experienced guide. (Available before December 18) 2. Sake brewery tour, Day 2: Tour Aizu's famous sake breweries in a private car tour together with a licensed guide. Start at 9:00 from Hotel Gran Deco and go directly to Homare Sake Brewery, which was awarded first place in the International Wine Challenge competition in 2015, in the category of Japanese sake. Continue the tour by exploring Kitakata town, famous for its delicious ramen and Yamatogawa sake brewery. Walk around the traditional area and old streets of Aizu-Wakamatsu before ending the tour at Aizu-Wakamatsu Station at 16:00. IMPORTANT: The sake brewery optional tour does not include lunch. Please bring Japanese yen in cash as there are no ATMs along the way and credit cards are not accepted. You will need about 3000 JPY in cash. 3. Snow rafting and ski, Day 1: Enjoy a day of fun in the snow! Try snow rafting and skiing at Urabandai's ski slope! One day lift ticket is included! (Available after December 19) -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- This is a specially designed tour that you can book only with us. You will not find this tour at any other travel company. Try it as a 2-day trip during your visit to Japan and discover beautiful hidden places that do not appear in standard guide books and travel packages.
strTitle: Enjoy the beautiful scenery at Urabandai's natural paradise

strIntroduction: In this tour you will be able to explore the local areas of Hiroshima prefecture! We will go to Okunojima Island in Seto Inland Sea, which is known as Rabbit island for its large population of cute rabbits. We will also stroll the old town of Saijo and visit an excellent sake brewery! We will go to Tadanoumi Station by Shinkansen and local train. Then we will take a ferry to get to Okunojima island. Walk around the island where rabbits will welcome you. You can feed them carrots. If you like hiking, you could go up to the observatory and see a spectacular view of the island and Seto Inland Sea. In the afternoon, we will take a train again and get off at Saijo Station. Saijo town is famous for its production of excellent sake. We will visit some sake breweries and enjoy sake tasting. You will see a video about the process of sake-making and learn a lot about this old Japanese tradition. Sake-related products such as soaps, snacks, and ice-cream can be purchased in the attached shop. Explore the countryside of Hiroshima in this day tour!
strTitle: See the Rabbit Island and taste sake near Hiroshima!

strIntroduction: This is a 5 hour private tour that takes you around the town of Matsusaka. The pick-up point will be at JR Matsusaka Station, but the guide can pick you up in the downtown Nagoya area by request (subject to an additional charge). Alternatively, I can inform you of how to get to Matsusaka Station by yourself. We will meet at Matsusaka Station. We will walk to the kimono shop to get changed. Please note that this is not the colorful kind of kimono - it is a kimono made of local textile in a beautiful indigo color that is referred as "Japan Blue." When you are ready to go, we will stroll through the town in kimono to go to a well-renowned restaurant in the area to try their famous sukiyaki with Matsusaka beef, a tender marbled beef produced in the area. (The price of this tour includes lunch at this restaurant.) After satisfying your taste buds and stomach, now it's time for you to get working! You will get to try weaving the same kind of cloth you are wearing during the tour. I will also take you to a scenic spot for you to take a nice picture of yourself in Matsusaka-momen kimono at the end of the tour. For those of you who are interested in Japanese history, I can also take you to some iconic historical places around the area.
strTitle: Weave and wear kimono and eat beef sukiyaki in Matsusaka!

strIntroduction: This is a walking tour in the historical Yanaka, Sendagi, and Nezu areas of Tokyo. The atmosphere of these areas is that of traditional Tokyo, and it allows visitors to catch a glimpse of old Japan. There is a variety of bakeries and shops that serve delicious sweets, in addition to several interesting temples, Shinto shrines, gardens, and small alleys lined with shops. We will visit all in this tour! Below is the sample itinerary of the tour: 11:00 North ticket gate of JR Nippori Station 11:10 Yanaka Ginza shopping street 12:00 Nezu Shrine 12:30 Lunch in the cafeteria of Tokyo University 13:00 Walk at Tokyo Uni - Lake Shinobazu - Ueno 13:30 The tour ends at the Ueno station. *The itinerary is subject to change and can be customized based on your preferences.
strTitle: Eat various gourmet local food during a Tokyo walking tour!

strIntroduction: Noto Peninsula in Ishikawa prefecture, central Japan, is located north of the popular touristic city Kanazawa and extends into the Sea of Japan. For centuries this area has been preserving a reputation of an undiscovered rural gem where you can still see authentic Japanese lifestyles that remain unchanged through time. Even today many Japanese people consider Noto Peninsula a borderline region that is somewhat detached from the modernity and industrial lifestyle of contemporary Japan. Here one can discover authentic rural lifestyles, traditional culture that cannot be seen anywhere else in the country, beautiful scenic views, and warm people. If you are looking for a true "off-the-beaten-track" destination in Japan, Noto Peninsula is going to exceed all your expectations! Noto Peninsula's population has been aging and decreasing, and that explains why the public transportation in the area is infrequent and underdeveloped. Several decades ago an extensive railway network used to connect the scattered villages, but it was abolished almost entirely (except the line which goes to the hot spring resort Wakura Onsen). Buses are very infrequent and the best way to explore Noto Peninsula is by car. In this half-day private car tour you will be able to discover the hidden gems of one of Japan's best countryside regions! You can choose to begin your car tour from Wajima city or the Wakura Onsen area. Both are connected to Kanazawa through highway buses or a train. It is possible to visit Noto Peninsula as a day trip from Kanazawa, or to stay overnight in Wajima or Wakura Onsen. Below you will find an example list of the highlights that can be included in each tour: Wajima start - Ushitsu, Noto town end (which is connected to Kanazawa by bus) *Vice versa route is possible too. - Kiriko Museum: exhibits the giant lantern Kiriko floats used during the peninsula's famous and unique Kiriko festival that runs from July to October in various villages. There are over 800 floats in Noto, some of which are over a hundred years old! - Senmaida terraced rice fields: a stunning view of over 1000 rice paddies developed on a seaside slope. Registered as a UNESCO World Heritage Agricultural Landscape. - Sosogi Coast and Koiji Beach: scenic coastlines along the way - Suzu Enden-mura: the only place in Japan where sea salt is produced manually through a laborious traditional method that you will see with your own eyes. Registered as a designated cultural heritage. - Sakasa-sugi: a unique old cedar tree whose branches touch the ground in a peculiar shape. - Mitsukejima: a picturesque rock island connected to the beach via a rocky path that you can cross. - The Blue Cave of the famous ryokan Lamp no Yado: built at the bottom of a steep seaside cliff. Wakura Onsen start - Kanazawa end: - Ganmon rocks and Kongo beach: scenic coastline along the way - Myojoji Temple: the local head temple of the Nichiren Buddhist sect. The temple has a spectacular 5-story pagoda. - Keta Taisha Shrine: a spiritual place which is said to bring good luck to lovers and those who seek marriage. - Chirihama Beach: a unique beach where cars can drive over the sand! - Kita Residence: a former samurai house which used to belong to ancestors of the Minamoto samurai clan. Don't forget to also see the authentic Wajima Morning Market which is open everyday from 8:00 to 12:00 on the city's main street. Local old ladies offer their home-grown farming production for sale and create a charming atmosphere all over the neighborhood. The Wajima-lacquer shops and museums are also worth a visit, as this is one of the best valued lacquer art in Japan. Please note that the itinerary can be customized, as long as it fits the time limit. For longer or shorter itineraries, please contact us.
strTitle: Explore the countryside and rural beauty of Noto Peninsula!

strIntroduction: This is a very popular cultural activity which combines a short walk in Asakusa and the Tokyo Skytree area of Tokyo with a wadaiko drum session. Wadaiko is a traditional Japanese drum, and in this activity you will learn more about it and play it together with experienced performers. This tour is suitable for solo travelers as well as for big groups of up to 40 people. Children under 11 years old must be accompanied by a guardian. Please inform us about the height of the children so that we can prepare suitable-sized drums. Please come to this activity dressed in casual wear. T-shirts and shorts are recommended. Your clothes should allow you to move easily while playing the drums. Below are the details of this activity: - Meet-up with our English-speaking staff member at one of the following stations 30 minutes before the activity: A. Kuramae Station 蔵前駅 B. Ryogoku Station 両国駅 C. Skytree Station スカイツリー駅 D. Asakusa Station 浅草駅 - You will taken to the venue where we hold the activity and along the way you will have the chance to see the wonderful Asakusa and Skytree area of Tokyo. - A taxi can be used as well, but you will have to pay separately. - Arrive at our venue 10-15 minutes before the activity starts. Here is the program for the wadaiko drum activity: 1. Wadaiko drum performance appreciation - Listen to the instructor play the instrument 2. Wadaiko drum experience - Try playing the drum yourself 3. Learn more about wadaiko - Ask questions, the instructor will be happy to answer 4. Wadaiko drum session - Play together with the instructor 5. Photo time - You can put on the "happi" (traditional coat used when playing wadaiko) Time required: 1-5 guests, 60 minutes (1 instructor and 1 interpreter) 6-20 guests, 90 minutes (2 instructors and 1 interpreter) 20-40 guests, 90 minutes (3 instructors and 1 interpreter) Enjoy traditional Japanese culture with our music activity!
strTitle: Try Japanese wadaiko drum and see Asakusa and Tokyo Skytree

strIntroduction: Have you ever wondered how your name would be written in Japanese characters? Have you ever wanted to write your name in kanji with a calligraphy brush? If so, this activity will definitely provide you the best experience! In this lesson, you'll have the opportunity to create your own unique Japanese souvenir by writing your name in kanji on a paper fan, T-shirt, polo shirt, tank top, or tote bag. Your name will be translated into 2 or 3 different kanji characters with different meanings, and you can select a character that best suits your own personality. What’s more, you can even choose the colors of the ink! Maybe you believed that Shodo must be done on white paper with black ink? I’d like to break that kind of stereotype because I believe the most important thing is to have fun when learning about a foreign culture. Let's have an unforgettable experience together! I’m looking forward to seeing you in the next class! Flow of the class: 1. Learn about the history and tools of Shodo, Japanese calligraphy. 2. Practice basic brush techniques and composition. 3. Choose the best kanji that suits your personality and learn how to write your name in kanji. 4. Practice with washi (Japanese paper). 5. Choose a souvenir type and write your name on it. 6. Take your artwork back home so that you can show your friends and family! Choose between several lesson plans (Ume, Take, and Matsu) depending on the time of the activity (60, 90, or 120 minutes). By the way, what is Shodo? Shodo is a traditional way of writing kanji in Japan. For many centuries Japanese people have written kanji in a very elegant way to express their thoughts and feelings. Today, writing kanji using ink and a special brush has become a form of art. Some people say that it is a very relaxing experience and it can rid your mind and body of stress. At the same time, Shodo develops concentration while helping people to reflect their own style through the brush as it touches the paper.
strTitle: Enjoy Japanese Shodo calligraphy in Asakusa!

strIntroduction: Kyoto's concentration of many picturesque old temples guarantees that the autumn season in the city transforms into a true natural art fiesta. The maple trees, gingko trees, and the other species whose leaves turn spectacularly red, orange, and yellow can be found everywhere in Japan's old capital. The large amount of Japanese-style gardens that are part of Kyoto's temples attract thousands of visitors throughout November and early December. Visiting all the great autumn color spots in the city is nearly impossible, just like it is impossible to see all the great historical sites. This tour is specially designed to include some of the most scenic gardens in Kyoto where you can enjoy the stunning beauty of the autumn landscape and learn more about the local history. This is a private guided tour in which you will visit several temples and their attractive gardens. The itinerary will be as follows: - Tofukuji Temple, one of the best locations in Kyoto to see autumn colors thanks to the spacious grounds of the temple and the high concentration of maple trees. This is also one of Kyoto's oldest temples. - Kodaiji Temple, a true Zen sanctuary built in memory of the famous warlord Toyotomi Hideyoshi. There are two spectacular gardens, one of which is a classical Zen-style rock garden, while the other attracts plenty of visitors during the autumn season when the landscape turns into fiery colors. - Eikando Temple, another temple with spacious grounds built at the foot of a hill. One of its treasures is an impressive pagoda built halfway up the hill. Not only is the autumn view from the observatory beautiful, but the evening illuminations of the temple's gardens will become an unforgettable memory from your visit to Kyoto. Note: The temples included in the itinerary may change depending on the availability of autumn colors. Alternatives will be Kiyomizu Temple, Chionin Temple, and Nanzenji Temple. Don't miss your chance to see some of Kyoto's spectacular autumn spots in this tour designed specially for the purpose of your aesthetic satisfaction.
strTitle: Visit Kyoto's most famous autumn gardens and temples

strIntroduction: Korankei Valley is widely known as one of Japan's most scenic autumn color spots. The reason for this is the presence of over 4000 maple trees which turn beautifully red in November every year. The valley follows the stream of Tomoe River along the slopes of Mt Iimori where a Zen temple named Kojakuji was built in 1427. Several centuries later, during the Edo period, the temple's priest started planting maple trees along the river and encouraged local people to do the same. This resulted in over 4000 maple trees planted which continue to fascinate visitors even in present days. During the peak of the autumn season in November, the valley becomes an outdoor venue for an autumn foliage festival which includes plenty of food stalls and stage events. The night-time illuminations of the red maples trees along the rapid streams of Tomoe River are a truly magnificent view! But this is not all! Korankei Valley is also home to Asuke Yashiki Village, a small craft cottage with traditional thatched-roof houses where plenty of local crafts are displayed. You can learn a lot about the local lifestyle of the people in Aichi, and your guide will help you to participate in some of the hands-on activities offered, such as indigo dyeing, basket weaving, and the making of Aichi's famous local sweet "goheimochi". Your guide will meet you at Higashi-Okazaki Station on Meitetsu Nagoya Line (about 30 minutes from Nagoya or Toyohashi Stations) from where you will take a bus to Korankei Valley. Enjoy the best of Aichi's nature and culture at Korankei, the valley of autumn colors!
strTitle: See over 4000 maple trees in Korankei, a famous autumn spot!

strIntroduction: Shosenkyo Gorge is a little-known beautiful ravine along the rapid streams of Arakawa River in central Yamanashi prefecture. This hidden spot is easily accessible by public transportation from Tokyo and makes for a wonderful day trip all year around, but especially during the autumn color season when the hill slopes are entirely covered in red, orange, and yellow! In this private guided tour, you will go on a pleasant trekking starting from the outskirts of Kofu city and going further into the natural realm of the gorge. The trail is about 4-kilometers long, and the terrain is flat so it is easy to walk. Along the way, you will pass a large number of interesting river rocks, each with its own legend and story that will be explained by your guide. Particularly interesting is the giant Kakuenbo cliff, said to resemble the landscape of Mt Tai in China. You will then reach the 30-meter high Sengataki waterfall, which is one of the highlights of Shosenkyo Gorge. After that, you will ride the Shosenkyo Ropeway to an observation deck from where you can have a commanding view over Mt Fuji and the autumn colors of the surrounding mountain hills. Near the base of the ropeway is the museum of crystals, as Shosenkyo Gorge is home to Japan's most productive crystal mines. You can also try the local specialty "houtou" - a hot pot with flat noodles and vegetables! Shosenkyo Gorge can be visited in the green season, as well as in the autumn color season from late October to mid-November. If you want to see the autumn foliage in the wild nature but don't have much free time in your schedule, this one-day tour is just for you!
strTitle: Enjoy the autumn colors and the nature of Shosenkyo Gorge

strIntroduction: The autumn season is the second best time to visit Japan after the sakura cherry blossom season in the spring. Exploring the nature and especially the mountains of countryside Japan offers fantastic opportunities to enjoy the amazing fiery colors of the autumn foliage. However, you can find many beautiful spots also in the cities, and Tokyo has several iconic gardens with a high concentration of Japanese maple trees, ginkgo trees, poplars, and other plants which turn red, yellow, and orange. In fact, Tokyo city's symbol is a leaf of the ginkgo tree which guarantees that you will be able to enjoy the autumn beauty in many places around the city. This is a private guided tour in which you will visit the following iconic autumn colors spots in Tokyo: - Gaienmae's Icho Namiki, a well-known ginkgo tree-lined boulevard which leads to the Olympic Stadium - the main venue of Tokyo Olympics 2020. The giant trimmed ginkgo trees turn golden in late November and produce a unique urban atmosphere. - Koishikawa Korakuen Garden, a historical Japanese-style garden from the Edo period where you will discover a variety of autumn hues around the picturesque pond. The variety of maple trees here is spectacular. - The University of Tokyo Hongo Campus, known for its gingko tree-lined alleys turning fully yellow at the peak of the season. The quiet surroundings of the campus are an ideal place for kids to play with the fallen leaves that cover the ground like a soft yellow carpet. - Rikugien Garden, one of Japan's best gardens where you can enjoy the autumn colors not only during daytime, but also in a spectacular evening illumination which produces a truly outstanding mystical atmosphere. During the tour, your guide will tell you more about the history of the nearby spots and will make sure that you see the best autumn colors at the right time. Book this tour and discover the beauty of the Japan's nature in autumn.
strTitle: Take a private tour around Tokyo's iconic autumn color spots

strIntroduction: Did you know that Nagoya is one of Japan's most famous otaku destinations? While Tokyo's Akihabara district is internationally famous, Nagoya successfully challenges its popularity with global-scale events such as the World Cosplay Summit, held with enormous success annually in the city. Thousands of anime and cosplay fans from all over the world gather in Nagoya to see some of its top-class otaku spots. The city also has attractive anime shops and game centers where you can have the rare chance to take photos of yourself dressed in various costumes. Moreover, in Nagoya you can easily see a live performance of a cute idol group and even take pictures with them! All of these unique experiences are included in this special otaku tour targeted for the most passionate pop-culture fans! This is a private half-day (evening) guided tour in which you will visit Nagoya's most famous pop-culture destinations. You will have the chance to enter facilities that are otherwise difficult to access for foreign visitors and experience the authentic spirit of Japan's youth culture! Below is the itinerary for this tour: 16:00 - Meet in front of the Tourism Information Center in Oasis 21 (Sakae). Visit the Studio Ghibli shop and the Shonen Jump shop to find goods related to your favourite anime characters. 17:00 - Take the subway to Osu Shopping District and visit an authentic maid cafe where you will enjoy a maid performance and have dinner (one drink included). 18:00 - Enter a popular game arcade where you will have the rare chance to try cosplay and have cute "purikura" photos taken while you are dressed up in a costume of your choice. 18:30 - Visit a famous local anime shop where you can find tons of anime-related goods, character figurines, manga, and cosplay costumes. 19:00 - Enjoy the live show of the local idol group BSJ and have photos taken with the members. 20:00 - End of tour. Note: This tour is offered every day except on irregular days when the idol group BSJ does not have a live show. Depending on their schedule, the tour might end earlier or later. Please ask when booking.
strTitle: Explore Nagoya's pop-culture: cosplay, maid cafes, anime

strIntroduction: Lake Shinji near Matsue city, Shimane prefecture, is known as one of Japan's best sunset spots. The view of the setting sun behind the lake is truly marvelous and unforgettable! You can enjoy it from the shores, but it is even better if you take the sunset cruise of the sightseeing boat that takes you on a 1-hour ride around the lake. Buy your ticket now and use it within a month to ride the sightseeing boat over Lake Shinji! You can choose to ride on one of the following cruises: - 9:30 (pier 1), 9:35 (pier 2) - 11:00 (pier 1), 11:05 (pier 2) - 12:30 (pier 1), 12:35 (pier 2) - 14:00 (pier 1), 14:05 (pier 2) - 15:30 (pier 1), 15:35 (pier 2) - 17:00 (pier 1), 17:05 (pier 2) - sunset cruise - the exact time changes every week according to the sunset. Please ask in advance. Pier 2 is located closer to Matsue Station, within a 5 minutes walk on foot. Drinks are available for additional fee. Please note that in some cases the boat may be privately rented and you will be asked to ride on a different time/day. We will send the ticket to your hotel in advance. Please note that we need 3 working days for the delivery.
strTitle: Ride a sightseeing boat over Lake Shinji near Matsue city

strIntroduction: Shiretoko Peninsula is a UNESCO Natural World Heritage Site since 2005. The national park in the north-east part of Hokkaido is widely known for its pristine natural views, undeveloped areas and a variety of wildlife including Hokkaido's symbol - the brown bear. The biodiversity in Shiretoko attracts plenty of visitors every summer when the park is open. One of the best ways to explore the unspoiled beauty of this natural park is to take a sightseeing boat along the rugged western coastline of the peninsula, starting from Utoro port. The boat will pass along tall and almost vertical cliffs, hidden rock beaches and impressive waterfalls that cannot be seen from the nature walking trails on the ground. This is a fantastic chance to see not only the splendor of the coastline, but also to spot brown bears from a safe distance! Of course, you can see also other animals, including sea mammals such as dolphins and whales! You can choose between two different cruising courses: 1) Short 70-minute cruise starting from Utoro port and going to Mt Io and Kamuiwakkayu Falls whose river originates from an acidic hot spring. This is the only opportunity to see the waterfall as it's not visible or accessible from the ground. This cruise is available at various times of the day between April 20 and November 20: - 8:15 - 10:30 - 12:30 - 14:30 - 16:30 (only until September 15) - 16:00 (only between September 16 and October 5) 2) Long 3-hour cruise starting from Utoro and going all to way to Cape Shiretoko. In this cruise you will see even more hidden beaches and waterfalls. As part of the experience you will receive a special rice bowl with salmon roe - a local specialty of Hokkaido! This cruise is available between June 1 and October 10 and starts from 10:00 am. Please note that the tour may be cancelled in case of stormy weather.
strTitle: Take a sightseeing boat along the dramatic Shiretoko coast

strIntroduction: Are you looking for some fun activities to do in Miyako Island? If so, we have an amazing tour for you! Take this opportunity to go fishing in one of Japan's most beautiful ocean! You will also be able to eat the fish you just fished, which will be fresh and mouth-watering! Miyako Island (Miyakojima), located 300 kilometers south of the Okinawa Main Island and 100 kilometers north of the Yaeyama Islands, is known for some of Japan's best beaches! The beaches are Miyako Islands's most famous attraction, and this tour will offer you an opportunity to fish at Ikema Island, connected to the northwestern corner of Miyako-jima by a bridge! Here is a detailed schedule of the tour: - From 9:00 to 12:00, or from 13:00 to 16:00 - Please note that the schedule can change, due to the weather. Why you will love this tour: - Ikema Island, which is connected to the northwestern corner of Miyako Island by a bridge, has spectacular views above and below the sea. - The Ikema Wetlands in the center of the island is a wildlife protection area, and home to variety of wildlife animals, such as ducks, egrets, and waders. - You will be amazed by the beautiful beach, corals, and colorful fish at Ikema Island! - A professional guide will teach you how to fish! - Beginners at fishing and children are welcome to join! - You will never forget the beauty of Ikema Island! - You will see unique shells and many tropical fishes! - You can fish banana fishes, and bonitos! - You can eat the fish you just fished out of the sea! This tour will make your trip unforgettable! Join this tour and enjoy fishing at Ikema Island! We look forward to go fishing with you! Photos by: -https://flic.kr/p/NBPsF -https://flic.kr/p/5u7Npx -https://flic.kr/p/9UANQk -https://flic.kr/p/dNZnha -https://flic.kr/p/7jhuxD -https://flic.kr/p/5cctkE
strTitle: Enjoy Fishing at Miyako Island!

strIntroduction: Have you seen the beautiful night view in Tokyo? If not, why not take a ride in a houseboat around Tokyo Bay while enjoying the night view with a delicious dinner and drinks? This would be the perfect tour for you if you wish to have a relaxing night with your friends, family, or with your special someone! There are 2 courses from which you can choose from: A) Odaiba and Sumida river course (Duration: 2h30min) You can enjoy the night view of Odaiba, Rainbow bridge and Tokyo Sky Tree! Available dates: November 6th, 7th, 20th, 21st, 22nd, 27th, 28th, December 6th, 20th, 22nd, 25th. B) Tokyo Sky Tree Course (Duration: 2h30min) Go along Sumida river and get off at Tokyo Sky Tree Available dates: November 8th, 23rd, 29th, December 13rd, 18th, 23rd, 27th. Why you love it: - You can enjoy the beautiful night view from the houseboat in Tokyo Bay! - You will love the delicious Japanese styled dinner such as Sashimi and Tenpura! - Enjoy the fresh Sashimi! - You can drink as much as you want on the houseboat! -You can take pictures of Tokyo Sky Tree, which is the highest tower in Japan! - The illumination of the Rainbow bridge is breathtakingly beautiful! - It would be amazing if you spend the beautiful night on the houseboat in Tokyo Bay during your stay in Tokyo! Since this tour is popular among the tourists and the local people, we highly recommend you to book it as soon as possible so you do not miss this chance to enjoy the night view! Join this tour and make your trip unforgettable! strIntroduction: A) Day Cruise (Duration: 45min) Santa Maria goes around Osaka Bay, and you can enjoy the beautiful view from the Santa Maria. You could bump into pirates that are on board! Santa Maria’s captain is Santana, and his crew is Mario. A lot of children will love this course! B) Twilight Cruise (Duration: 90 min) [Until 28th September][Weekends Only] Santa Maria will be lit up in the evening. Osaka Bay will also be illuminated with colorful lights! You will enjoy the beautiful view from Santa Maria, which is more romantic than the daytime. C) Day Cruise + Osaka Aquarium (Kaiyukan) admission fee You can enjoy the cruise and can also visit the Osaka Aquarium, which is near the boarding gate to the Santa Maria! Osaka Aquarium is one of Japan's most spectacular aquarium. It introduces various forms of life inhabiting in the Pacific Rim in a well organized and impressive way. strIntroduction: Mount Koya (Koyasan) is the center of Shingon Buddhism, an important Buddhist sect which was introduced to Japan in 805 by Kobo Daishi (also known as Kukai), one of Japan's most significant religious figures. A small, secluded temple town has developed around the sect's headquarters that Kobo Daishi built on Koyasan's wooded mountaintop. It is also the site of Kobo Daishi's mausoleum and the start and end point of the Shikoku 88 Temple Pilgrimage. Koyasan is also one of the best places to experience an overnight stay at a temple lodging (shukubo) where you can get a taste of a monk's lifestyle, eating vegetarian monk's cuisine (shojin ryori) and attending the morning prayers. Koyasan has some of the best temples where you can stay overnight. If you would like to experience the Japanese style of meals and accommodation, why not trying this temple stay? Check-in time 11:00 Check-out time 10:00 Why we love it: - You will enjoy experiencing the Japanese cultures! - You will love the Japanese food at the temple stay! Healthy and fresh food! - Temple stay is the great way to experience Japanese cultures by yourself! strTitle: Stay Overnight at a Temple in Mount Koya!

strIntroduction: 8:00 to 9:00 am, I will pick you up from the desired accommodation. Please wait at the accommodation lobby. ※ The exact time and place will be decided by a contact with the applicant. Vast scenery of white ice fields is unique in the winter. The sound of the shrinking ice will echo from under your feet in this season. No need of provisions or special tools! You can join us empty-handed. We will give you all necessary smelt fishing instruments - "hand spring rod," "4-hocks", "bait", "drilling", etc. First the guide will open a hole in the ice. The thickness of the ice is greater than or equal to 60 cm. You can eat the smelt fish you caught with tempura on the spot. Bringing rice balls and beer is also okay. I will send you off from from Tatsukobu Lake to the hotel. (※ 12: 00 ~ 13: 00 pm arrival) ※ after the tour ends, it is also possible to send you off to Kushiro Airport or to JR Kushiro Station.
strTitle: Ice fishing for smelt in Kushiro Marsh

strIntroduction: In this tour you will first go to Fushimi Inari Shrine - the central of all Inari shrines around Japan where the spirit of the fox is enshrined. Fushimi Inari is known for hundreds of vermillion gates going up the sacred mountain. Next you will visit Chokenji Temple which will fascinate you with its architecture and massive walls. The atmosphere here is mystical and special. You will then ride a traditional Japanese boat along the river that flows between the small sake cellars, breweries and shops which have remained from the old centuries. Your tour will continue to some of the famous breweries which are open for visitors and you will even have the opportunity to taste several locally made sake products. The sake brewing in Fushimi flourished during the old centuries because of the fresh and high-quality water springing from the mountain. In case you you book the hotel pick up option,your tour guide will pick you up from your hotel in central Kyoto. The picking applicable hotels are limited to the hotels between Higashi-oji-dori and Nishi-oji-dori (to the east and west) and Imadegawa-dori and Jujo-dori(to the north and south). At the end of the tour the guide will assist you in finding the transportation for your next destination or hotel. This tour runs between April and November when the boats operate.
strTitle: Kyoto Fushimi 1-day Tour with sake tasting

strIntroduction: In this activity you will learn how to make delicious sushi instructed by a professional Japanese sushi chef! The location is in Tsukishima, one of the artificial islands in Tokyo Bay located just besides Tsukiji Fish Market. On Saturdays there are special tours in the market before the sushi class! You can book one of the options below: A) Sushi making class with a professional chef Schedule: Weekdays from 16:30 to 18:00 Minimum number of participants: 5 Meeting place: Tsukishima station (subway Oedo line or Yurakucho line) B) Tsukiji Fish Market tour and sushi making class Schedule: Saturday from 9:00 to 12:30 Minimum number of participants: 5 Meeting place: Tsukiji-shijou Station (subway Oedo line) A sushi chef will guide you inside Tsukiji market and show you around the highlights of the market from outside, including the famous Namiyoke Inari Shrine. Then we will go to Tsukishima by subway for the cooking class.
strTitle: Make sushi with a professional chef in Tsukishima, Tokyo

strIntroduction: Ikebukuro is famous for its shopping area for otaku products and anime. We can explore some of them on this tour. The subculture is not the only highlight of Ikebukuro. Historical spots and modern architecture are also places of interest. There are shops where you can examine traditional Japanese handcrafts. Earthquake simulation at Ikebukuro Life Safety Learning Center is a valuable activity which helps you imagine how the Japanese felt during the Great East Japan Earthquake in 2011. There are also plenty of interesting cafe and bars. We finish up this tour at one of them. After I pick you up at hotel where you stay at 9:00am, we will move to Ikebukuro Station by public transportation. Below are the main sites we will visit in this tour: Tokyo Metropolitan Theater Jiyugakuen Myonichikan Ikebukuro Life Safety Learning Center (earthquake simulation) Lumine restaurant floor P'Parco (nicocafe, Evangelion shop) Animate (anime shop) Mikunikoji lane (old style bar street) Otome road (shopping area for otaku products and cafe) Sunshine city Toshima ward office building (private residences are at higher levels, first and only in Japan) Architectural buildings of Von Jour Caux (Tachinomiya Kippei) The tour finishes around 5:00pm.
strTitle: Learn all about Ikebukuro in a private walking tour

strIntroduction: This will definitely be an unforgettable experience! Activity options: 1. Standard course: from 5:00pm to 7:00pm. Visit 3 local places in Ueno. 2. Early start course: From 3:00pm to 5:00pm. Visit 3 local places in Ueno. 3. Cross town course: From 4:00pm to 6:00pm. Visit 1 local place in Ueno and another local place in Shinbashi. *Starting time is flexible and can be arranged upon request; however, there may be waiting time to get seats, as most local bars do not take reservations. Who are the bar hopping masters? - Fluent in English even after drinking a considerable amount of alcohol! - Have a deep knowledge of the local area including Tokyo's very complicated transportation system. Enjoy the nightlife at Tokyo's local bars!
strTitle: Enjoy Bar Hopping in local Ueno with a Bar Hopping Master!

strIntroduction: On this tour we are going to visit Tokyo's Kita Ward, which is not so well-known in spite of its proximity to the city center. We will visit areas like Oji, Jujo, and Akabane where you can experience the real downtown Tokyo lifestyle. This tour starts from a well-known garden among Japanese called Kyu-Furukawa Garden. It combines two different styles of gardens. The western-style building and garden were designed and built by the famous architect Josiah Conder. Not so many people are familiar with Kita Ward, but there are lots of interesting spots scattered around. Most of the historical places are in quiet surroundings and you can discover hidden aspects of the Japanese culture and learn more about Buddhism and Shintoism in a relaxed atmosphere. The downtown shopping street, on the other hand, is very lively and you will have the chance to try local foods for an unbelievably reasonable price and get to know the real lifestyle of locals. We will finish up this tour in the bar area on the west side of Akabane station. Below is the basic schedule of the tour: - Pickup at your hotel at 9:00am - Head for Kyu-Furukawa Gardens by public transportation - Walk to Nanashajinja Shrine and Asukayama Park (pass-by) - Walk to Hokutopia Tower where you can enjoy the view of Tokyo from the observatory while having lunch - Move to Jujo-chuo shopping street by train and walk to Jujoginza downtown shopping street, where you can enjoy Japanese sweets of your preference - Walk to Shimizuzaka Park, Katori Shrine, Fumonin Temple, and Akabane Ichibangai, where you can finish up the tour with refreshments at around 5:00pm.
strTitle: Explore the fascinating contrasts of Tokyo's Kita Ward
